Overview:     The Radiochemical Analysis Group conducts fundamental and applied research resulting in new capabilities in trace element and radionuclide detection, environmental assessment and remediation, treaty verification, and proliferation detection and prevention. The group applies a broad range of instrument and method development knowledge, specialized chemical separation methods, and advanced radiometric and spectrometric technologies in support of national security missions. Staff are typically involved in multiple projects which enables each person to contribute to basic science studies as well as the applied missions of the Group. Staff use highly developed processes, specialized methods, and state-of-the-art analytical instrumentation to perform work that spans the spectrum of basic science to applied analytical services. Research areas include: radiochemistry, nuclear materials chemistry and analysis, instrument development, safeguards, fate and transport, and nuclear signatures. Much of the analytical services work that is performed requires measuring radionuclides at trace levels.        The Radiochemical Analysis Group has two primary technical thrusts: Radiochemistry and Analytical Chemistry. Given recent and projected growth, the current Radiochemical Analysis Group, needs to be split into two groups, the Analytical Chemistry Group and the Radiochemistry Group, resulting in each having approximately 45 staff. The Analytical Chemistry Group will specialize in R&D for mass spectrometry optimization, operational bulk actinide sample preparations, and transitioning research processes and methods to operations. The Radiochemistry Group will specialize in radiochemistry operations and R&D and particle processing operations and optimization. We are seeking dynamic leaders for both new groups.        The Analytical Chemistry Group is focused on:         Mass spectrometry and analytical chemistry support to a wide range of fields that spans the entire application space of the group. Team members provide analytical services as well as design, build and maintain state-of-the-art instruments utilized in the nuclear nonproliferation and safeguards application spaces.      Performing forensic analysis through dissolution and separations of trace analytes in bulk matrices. Samples are typically analyzed using thermal ionization mass spectrometry. The work is done primarily supporting national security sponsors.      R&D for instrument and methodology development and integration of Machine Learning for our mission partners. The group benefits from mission leaders who specialize in technology transfer and engagement with end user sponsors.      Spatially-resolved measurements of elemental and isotopic compositions of solid materials utilizing secondary ion mass spectrometry (SIMS) to support Operations and R&D. With the ability to analyze any element in the periodic table, applications vary widely.        The Radiochemistry Group is focused on:         Specialized radiochemical separations of unique, quantity-limited samples to advance national security interests. Research and development is focused on increasing the number of analytes that can be isolated from a single sample, increasing chemical yields and analyte purity, lowering detection limits and uncertainties for analytical methods, and decreasing the time to complete analyses. Analytical techniques used include radioanalytical methods, elemental analyses using optical emission spectroscopy and kinetic phosphorescence, and quadrupole mass spectrometry.      Providing radioanalytical and nuclear chemistry solutions for a variety of national security applications, such as nuclear data measurements, nuclear nonproliferation, and nuclear explosion monitoring. Unique skill sets include planning and conducting irradiation experiments for national security related R&D, such as fission yield measurements or isotope production; preparing samples, ranging from spent fuel to environmental levels, for trace-level analytical techniques; and offering guidance on radiochemical processing to abate radioiodine and radioxenon emissions produced by civilian applications.      Performing nuclear forensics operations and R&D to support national security sponsors. The capabilities include sample processing using a specialized particle analysis method, optical microscopy, electron microscopy and TIMS analyses.           Success in the position as a Group Leader will be characterized by:           Establishment of a technical vision for the group that the staff embrace      Commitment to safe conduct of operations and exemplary management of laboratory activities, space, and equipment      Focus on staff development and nurturing careers of recognized technical experts and future organizational leaders      Robust recruiting, especially in radiochemistry and data science      Elevation of PNNL's role in the science and engineering community, including university partnerships      Stronger ties between fundamental science capabilities and applied missions      Partnership in developing proposals that integrate capabilities into business planning     Responsibilities:        As a group leader, you will supervise approximately 45 staff across technical disciplines and support You will focus on staff and career development of the next-generation of leaders as well as the recruiting of high-caliber technical talent.      As a technical leader, you will support projects focused on analytical chemistry so that you know the challenges staff face. You will advise and influence senior leadership as it invests internal resources to position for the future.      As a member of the division leadership team, you will help create, shape, and guide our strategy that defines the future of our 300+ person organization. You will partner with six other technical groups to develop integrated capabilities across technical domains that meet national security challenges.     Qualifications:        Minimum Qualifications:           Bachelor's Degree plus 10 years of experience;      or Advanced Degreeplus 8 years of experience           Preferred Qualifications:           Advanced degree in chemistry, chemical engineering, or related engineering/science plus 8 years of relevant experience.      Proven ability to execute on a vision, making it real and tangible. This includes understanding the mission landscape and the ability to bring the mission to the group. The next leader needs to articulate the group's role in the organization's strategy and inspire others and lead by influence.      Demonstrated leadership of people, in particular other leaders. Candidates must have high emotional intelligence and strong soft skills to effectively integrate across capabilities and build bridges. This includes understanding the role of scientists and engineers with the ability to nurture their careers uniquely. External to the group, the leader must influence stakeholders across the organization.      Experience with operational risk. This includes knowledge of information security, safe conduct of research, and a demonstrated ability to balance safety/security with productivity.      Ability to effectively communicate across technical expertise and organizational cultures, translating vision and objectives for the workforce and distilling complex programs/technologies for diverse audiences.     Hazardous Working Conditions/Environment:        No hazardous working conditions / environment are anticipated for this position.    Additional Information:        This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a federal security clearance.              Requirements:           U.S. Citizenship      Background Investigation: Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter in accordance with 10 CFR 710, Appendix B.      Drug Testing: All Security Clearance positions are Testing Designated Positions, which means that the candidate selected is subject to pre-employment and random drug testing. In addition, applicants must be able to demonstrate non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for the 12 consecutive months preceding completion of the requisite Questionnaire for National Security Positions (QNSP).           Note: Applicants will be considered ineligible for security clearance processing by the U.S. Department of Energy until non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for 12 months can be demonstrated.    Testing Designated Position (TDP):        This position is a Testing Designated Position (TDP). The candidate selected for this position will be subject to pre-employment and random drug testing for illegal drugs, including marijuana, consistent the Controlled Substances Act and the PNNL Workplace Substance Abuse Program.    About PNNL:        Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is a world-class research institution powered by a highly educated, diverse workforce committed to the values of Integrity, Creativity, Collaboration, Impact, and Courage. Every year, scores of dynamic, driven people come to PNNL to work with renowned researchers on meaningful science, innovations and outcomes for the U.S. Department of Energy and other sponsors; here is your chance to be one of them!           At PNNL, you will find an exciting research environment and excellent benefits including health insurance, flexible work schedules and telework options. PNNL is located in eastern Washington State—the dry side of Washington known for its stellar outdoor recreation and affordable cost of living. The Lab’s campus is only a 45-minute flight (or ~3 hour drive) from Seattle or Portland, and is serviced by the convenient PSC airport, connected to 8 major hubs.    Commitment to Excellence, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Equal Employment Opportunity:        Our laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment dedicated to solving critical challenges in fundamental sciences, national security, and energy resiliency. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. In support of this commitment, we encourage people of all racial/ethnic identities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment.              Pacific Northwest National Laboratory considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status, and any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local laws.                    We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures and in employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at hr@pnnl.gov.    Drug Free Workplace:        PNNL is committed to a drug-free workplace supported by Workplace Substance Abuse Program (WSAP) and complies with federal laws prohibiting the possession and use of illegal drugs.

job_title: Sr. Data Scientist - Inventory Positioning - Remote
job_Description: Job Description     Nordstrom is a specialty retailer offering the very best in fashion and customer service since 1901. Five values guide how we work together and how we deliver analytic insights and data science products. We are customer-obsessed, owners at heart, curious and ever-changing, here to win, and committed to extending ourselves. We understand that our success comes from empowering our employees to set their sights high and deliver exceptional service to our customers.        The Inventory Positioning Data Science team’s mission is to use machine learning and optimization to power Nordstrom’s decision making about where inventory needs to be to best serve customers what they want, where they want it, and when they want it. We predict how much of which types of inventory Nordstrom will have in various locations in the future to enable our merchants and supply chain partners to best serve our customers on their terms. We build and deploy models to allocate inventory to the stores and fulfillment centers that are closest to where we anticipate customers will want it. We collaborate with product management, program management, and engineering colleagues to provide data-driven solutions. We welcome feedback, and we evaluate our products’ performance over time to identify and realize improvements over the long term. In everything we do, we prioritize making a big impact for our customers by improving the selection of products available to them on their terms.        We are committed to building teams that reflect the diversity of our customers, and we understand that active inclusion is central to how Nordstrom wins. We’re an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals from underrepresented backgrounds to apply!        Read this first:  Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, but dont necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. Wed love to have a chat to see what skills/experience you are able to bring to this team.        What youll do         Demonstrate a deep understanding of the business and inform how we can use data science products to progress from our current state of inventory management and our target state using machine learning and optimization      Proactively identify high-value opportunities and influence stakeholders’ roadmaps      Master complex data sources, function as a subject matter expert in inventory across all of Nordstrom’s businesses (i.e., Nordstrom, Nordstrom Rack, and Trunk Club), and collaborate with data partners to improve and expand the team’s access to internal data      Lead efforts to develop and deploy robust end-to-end data science products, i.e., work across the product lifecycle from research and discovery to operationalization and production      Work closely with data engineering partners to use and improve our internal Machine Learning Platform infrastructure      Collaborate with and mentor teammates, learning from and sharing your expertise with them      Create resources and opportunities for learning and growth across our broader community of data scientists and data analysts           Skills and experience you have         Exemplary SQL skills, producing repeatable and robust code      Expert understanding of statistics, data analysis, and data visualization      Fluent Python and/or R skills and extensive experience with machine learning and data science libraries (e.g., ggplot, scikit-learn, numpy, pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, etc.)      Advanced optimization skills and experience solving complex optimization problems      Experience with software engineering best practices, including story estimation, test-driven development, code review, and version control with git      Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) ecosystem or similar and with tools like Docker, Airflow, Kubernetes, or similar      Significant experience with deploying models in production      Passion for problem-solving and track record of machine learning innovation      Relationship-building and clear communication targeted to specific audiences      Commitment to collaboration, regularly presenting progress, insights, and recommendations to stakeholders, and incorporating feedback into design of new models and model improvements      Outstanding technical writing and documenting      Excellent written and verbal communication skills           What your background may look like         5+ years of hands-on data science experience. Retail experience, especially involving inventory and/or supply chain, is a plus      7+ years of experience querying data with SQL      Degree in a quantitative field or equivalent experience. MS or PhD is a plus           A few of our perks         Tremendous opportunity to work on exciting machine learning problems at the heart of Nordstrom’s strategy to be the best fashion retailer      Lightning talks and other opportunities to learn and share with our team of data science and analytics experts      Hackathons      Career advancement opportunities      Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, 401(k) match      A supportive, encouraging culture guided by our company values      Nordstrom discount! At  McKinstry , we’re proud to be a diverse and passionate group of innovators and problem-solvers, builders and engineers, mentors, and students. We believe the world needs curious, forward-thinking, solutions-oriented people who want to make our planet better. We are committed to strengthening our diversity through recruiting, developing, and retaining professionals from all backgrounds, and we believe that promoting diversity, equity, and inclusivity is an integral component of our continuing quest To Build a Thriving Planet. If you are looking to leave a purposeful mark on the world, then McKinstry is the place for you.  More than just words on a wall, our  values  speak to who we are, the ideals we hold in high esteem, and the behaviors that demonstrate our unique culture.  Action for Impact  is our plan for transformative change. We look to make a lasting impact on our industry and within our communities by addressing the climate, affordability, and equity crises head-on.  This role will work closely with our electrical construction business leaders, interact with executives and be the main point of operational and administrative contact for multiple business lines. This group is fun, fast-paced, and has high expectations from their partners. You will work as part of a centralized operational team that provides administrative leadership to our business lines. This is an enablement role responsible for anchoring culture, managing multiple projects at a time, and managing expectations for multiple stakeholders. This team works hard and plays hard but does expect a hybrid in-person model of three days a week in the office.   Here's where you come in:  We are currently seeking a  Software Engineering Manager  to join the team as a member of our growing Technology division.   You're great at:  Technical Contribution   Contribute to and/or participate in the review of software solution designs and architectural approaches.  Attend regular team standups and participate in backlog grooming activities.  Assist in building out Agile approaches across Software Engineering organization.  Participate in cross-functional teams focused on providing well designed, end-to-end IT solutions.  Act as a technology consultant to the organization – introducing technology and process changes that make McKinstry more nimble, productive, competitive and profitable.   Technical Leadership   In collaboration with leadership, develop and ensure use of policies and procedures based on industry best practices, while continuing to introduce best of breed tools and solutions.  Regularly collaborate with leadership to inform decisions about people, processes, tools, and technology  Establish and track metrics and measures to ensure achievement of system value, stability, and availability.  Manage full lifecycle development of software engineering solutions.   People Management   Communicate Software Engineering vision and strategies with the team and other departments at McKinstry.  Regularly review team member work activities and provide day-to-day technical direction and mentoring.  Select, train, mentor and manage team members.  Stay informed of new technologies & industry practices and educate team members.   Other duties as assigned.   What we would like to see from you:   Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience required.  Demonstrated proficiency in managing software engineering teams focused on custom development and supporting and extending existing critical enterprise systems required.  Five (5) years of software development and applications management experience required.  Eight (8) years of experience/increasing responsibility with information technology and application systems.  Excellent organizational, prioritization and time management skills required.  Experience with the latest software engineering technologies, tools, and practices required.  Experience with Cloud development, deployment, scalability, optimization, security, and monitoring of application solutions required.  Experience of Agile methodologies and approaches required.  Experience with microservices and machine learning preferred.  Experience with Azure DevOps, MuleSoft, Microsoft SQL Server, Microsoft PowerBI, and C# preferred.   Physical Demands and Work Environment   Sitting for extended periods of time.  Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and to handle other computer components.  On call availability 24 hours 7 days a week.  Ability and willingness to travel regionally.  Provide personal transportation for meetings and job visits away from the office; reimbursed.   Why McKinstry:  Transformational change requires bold action. We must decarbonize our buildings and energy assets to combat climate change. We must tackle the affordability crisis by innovating waste out of our supply chain and dramatically cutting costs through improved productivity. We must deliver equitable outcomes to ensure healthy, high-performing buildings for all. Together, Building a Thriving Planet.  Building a collective commitment: Our values demand that we take accountability for diversity, equity, and inclusion. No single individual or organization can stem the tide of inequity alone. We must work together  People represent our most valued asset. By investing in our employees, we are also investing in the ongoing success of our company. We pride ourselves on offering a comprehensive, PeopleFirst benefits package to promote health and wellness, enhance work/life balance and ensure long-term stability for our employees and their families. Some of these benefits include:   A robust internal mobility program to help you develop your career  Competitive pay backed by 401(k) and profit-sharing plans.  Comprehensive medical, prescription drugs, vision, and dental.  Orca Card and free parking  Business mileage reimbursement and/or electric fleet vehicles for business travel and meetings  Up to 16 weeks of paid parental leave.  Adoption and IVF assistance.  Paid time off.  McKinstry University training and development.  McKinstry wellness programs and on-site gyms.  Community service and employee-directed charitable giving.   The McKinstry group of companies are equal opportunity employers. McKinstry is committed to strengthening our diversity through recruiting and retaining minority and women professionals from all backgrounds. Our commitment is consistent with our recognition that it is the outstanding people within McKinstry who have always been the source of our strength. We recognize that promoting diversity is an integral component of our continuing quest for organizational excellence.  This commitment to Equal Employment Opportunity is made equally as a social responsibility and as an economic and business necessity. Meta designs, builds and operates one of the largest globally-distributed CDNs in the world. As an Optimization Engineer for Meta's Edge Network, you will have a unique opportunity to use your broad engineering skills to partner with product engineering teams to improve user experience for billions of people across Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp, Messenger, Oculus, and many more products. You will build scalable systems that provide critical product performance insights, simulate end-to-end impact of massive scale events, and drive caching architecture decisions.    Optimization Engineer Responsibilities:  Work cross-functionally with highly technical software engineering and network engineering teams. Build systems and tools, develop capacity planning frameworks, and root-cause the hardest problems on some of the largest and most complex systems in the world. Build stochastic models to characterize demand at every layer of the CDN and write software to generate capacity plans optimized for reliability, performance, and cost constraints. Leverage machine learning and related techniques to deliver solutions for large network infrastructure problems. Build and maintain complex optimization models. Leverage data you produce to improve platform architecture and design.    Minimum Qualifications:  2+ years of coding experience in at least one programming language (e.g. PHP, Python, C++, or Java), and rapidly learning new development languages. Knowledge of network infrastructure and/or routing. Experience with data logging and processing at scale. Experience with analysis of network and performance metrics. Hands-on experience with large quantities of data. Experience partnering with highly technical engineering teams to solve open ended issues. Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Degree must be completed prior to joining Meta.    Preferred Qualifications:  Graduate work experience.     Facebook is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law.Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

job_title: Vice President, Enterprise Analytics and Data Science
job_Description: Description:     THE ROLE     The Vice President of Enterprise Analytics and Data Science leads the strategic direction and deployment of analytics tools and technologies, including data science and advanced analytics data products, across the Providence enterprise to optimize clinical, operational, and financial outcomes for long-term organizational success. The role leads the strategy for ensuring successful reporting and analytics across a diverse and federated analytics ecosystem. This role is responsible for partnering with regional and system-level stakeholders to build relationships that achieve alignment and gain efficiencies in our reporting and analytics work. This role will maximize the organization’s ability to access data naturally in workflow and to leverage the latest technologies to mine insights from our rich data assets through machine learning and artificial intelligence. This role is also accountable for designing and building out the Analytics Center of Excellence and a robust data literacy program to maximize the organization’s ability to leverage data to drive decision making at all levels.     The position will have operational responsibility over the Epic and Community Technologies Data Strategy, Analytics, & Reporting, Data Visualization & Modeling, User Experience & User Centered Design, Advanced Analytics & Data Science, Data Literacy and The Analytics Center of Excellence.     The role will maintain a position on key strategic and business leadership meetings to keep a pulse on the changing business needs and requirements. The position will lead efforts to simplify and optimize our reporting and analytics strategies while simultaneously understanding the future pressures and demands for data facing our organization in many different domains.     This position will partner with the Vice President of Information Management and Platform Engineering on how best to execute the Healthcare Intelligence Mission and Vision, including co-leading technology decisions and data strategy. In partnership with Executive Director of Engineering Program/Product Management, this role will set the strategy for the HI apps portfolio and advancing dashboard and apps UI/UX strategy and will seek opportunities to continue to innovate with advanced analytics to improve our capability to utilize the diverse datasets available internally and externally to drive improvement. These leaders collectively will create and maintain a world-class analytics function to utilize advanced data analytic tools and techniques to create unsurpassed clinical care for our patients.     ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS     The Vice President, Enterprise Analytics and Data Science will:         Develop short-and long-term vision and strategic plans for enterprise analytics, data literacy, products, and data science based on, vision, objectives, plans, and operating requirements.      Build a customer-service oriented tone and develop a responsive, effective team that keeps the mission of the organization top of mind.      Responsible for hiring, training and mentoring a global team of analysts, data scientists, AI experts, industrial and domain analytics professionals, including the ability to attract and retain high caliber caregivers.      Develop and maintain a world-class Analytics Center of Excellence for Providence, exemplifying analytics best practices, supporting an robust analytics community, and helping the entire enterprise to be confident with making decisions using data.      Develop Data Science, Industrial Analytics, AI capabilities and expertise to deliver value added services, extensions, analytics to our customers.      Design, Develop and manage new Analytics/AI service offerings to compliment Healthcare Intelligence Product portfolio.      Build, maintain, and govern analytics for business partners - this may be aligned to a specific market or for business partners directly.      Collaborates with other system and regional leaders, understanding end to end integrated processes and how to drive business value.      Help develop business case for proposed service offerings and initiatives, including cost/benefit estimates, market trends, competitive analysis, risk analysis, industry best practices.      Create, re-usable standard processes and artifacts that can be leveraged by teams across the teams for customer delivery.      Represent Healthcare Intelligence externally as a key subject matter expert with strategic technology partners in the data and analytics technologies domain.        Additional responsibilities include:         Executing on the target-state operating model and adoption process      Organizational, interpersonal, and communications skills and the ability to manage shifting priorities that are critical for success in this position.      Proven ability to interact at and communicate to all levels of an organization.      Familiarity with master data management, enterprise reporting, and data warehouse design and implementation techniques.        Qualifications:     IDEAL QUALIFICATIONS     Required experience/education for this position include:         Bachelor's Degree in a Technical or related field      More than 10 years of progressive leadership experience in analytics, data, and/or data science roles      Advanced ability to inspire and develop staff      Advanced ability to lead/manage others      Advanced ability to influence internal and/or external constituents      Advanced ability to represent the company with external constituents      Advanced ability to drive multiple projects to successful completion      Leadership experience in Data Science & Analytics roles ideally for an healthcare organization      Experience with enterprise dashboard and reporting platforms (e.g., Tableau, Oracle Business Intelligence, Business Objects.)      Experience leading a P&L with financial responsibilities and providing leadership for all functional services areas including experience handling customer escalations      Must be capable of working across organization and managing cross-functional working groups and virtual teams Sets aggressive goals and is accountable for continuously driving improved outcomes, leading change and ensuring highest quality work product.        Preferred experience/education for this position include:         Master's Degree in Public Health or related field      3 years of Healthcare experience.        We offer comprehensive, best-in-class benefits to our caregivers. For more information, visit     https://www.providenceiscalling.jobs/rewards-benefits/     Our Mission     As expressions of God’s healing love, witnessed through the ministry of Jesus, we are steadfast in serving all, especially those who are poor and vulnerable.     About Us     Providence is a comprehensive not-for-profit network of hospitals, care centers, health plans, physicians, clinics, home health care and services continuing a more than 100-year tradition of serving the poor and vulnerable. Providence is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Providence does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, veteran, military status, religion, age, creed, national origin, sexual identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, or any other basis prohibited by local, state, or federal law.     Schedule:  Full-time     Shift:  Day     Job Category:  Leadership     Location:  Washington-Redmond     Req ID:  322890

Overview:        Fred Hutchinson Cancer Center is an independent, nonprofit, unified adult cancer care and research center that is clinically integrated with UW Medicine, a world leader in clinical care, research and learning. The only National Cancer Institute-designated cancer center in the Pacific Northwest, Fred Hutch’s global leadership in bone marrow transplantation, HIV/AIDS prevention, immunotherapy, and COVID-19 vaccines has confirmed our reputation as one of the world’s leading cancer, infectious disease and biomedical research centers. Based in Seattle, Fred Hutch operates eight clinical care sites that provide medical oncology, infusion, radiation, proton therapy, and related services, and network affiliations with hospitals in five states. Together, our fully integrated research and clinical care teams seek to discover new cures to the world’s deadliest diseases and make life beyond cancer a reality.              At Fred Hutch, we believe that the innovation, collaboration, and rigor that result from diversity and inclusion are critical to our mission of eliminating cancer and related diseases. We seek employees who bring different and innovative ways of seeing the world and solving problems. Fred Hutch is in pursuit of becoming an antiracist organization. We are committed to ensuring that all candidates hired share our commitment to diversity, antiracism, and inclusion.              The     Sr. Radiation Safety Technician  provides ionizing radiation safety services to Center researchers using radioactive materials and radiation producing machines. Reports to the Radiation Safety Officer and works independently in performing daily responsibilities according to established policies and procedures, referring non-routine radiation safety issues to supervisor.    Responsibilities:        Assign personal dosimetry devices to Center researchers working with radioactive materials.      Assist in maintaining personnel dosimetry records and provide dosimetry information to researchers and supervisor as required or requested.      Perform routine dosimetry monitoring, ensuring exposures in public areas remain below regulatory limits.      Perform routine contamination surveys in laboratories utilizing radioactive materials and report results to researchers and supervisor.      Work with laboratories in a customer service oriented role for all radiation safety related matters.      Maintain Center-wide radioactive materials audit program documentation.      Calibrate portable survey instruments used in monitoring laboratories for radioactive contamination.      Produce quarterly and annual ALARA reports and graphs for Radiation Safety Committee.      Perform routine audits of laboratories and equipment within the scope of the radiation safety program.      Investigate abnormal occurrences, allegations or survey results at the request of the radiation safety officer.      Perform radioactive material shipments      Provide emergency response for radioactive spills.      Perform other duties as required.            Qualifications:        Associate's degree in chemistry, biology, or closely related scientific field.      Minimum of three years related radiation safety experience.      Additional related training or experience may substitute for educational requirement.           Fred Hutch has a mandatory COVID-19 vaccine requirement, with exceptions only for approved medical or religious accommodations.      As a condition of employment, newly hired employees must provide proof of vaccination or initiate the accommodations process before their first day of employment.              A statement describing your commitment and contributions toward greater diversity, equity, inclusion, and antiracism in your career or that will be made through your work at Fred Hutch is requested of all finalists.    Our Commitment to Diversity: We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act (VEVRAA) Employer. We are committed to cultivating a workplace in which diverse perspectives and experiences are welcomed and respected. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, ancestry, national origin, sex, age, disability (physical or mental), marital or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, political ideology, or membership in any other legally protected class. We are an Affirmative Action employer. We encourage individuals with diverse backgrounds to apply and desire priority referrals of protected veterans. If due to a disability you need assistance/and or a reasonable accommodation during the application or recruiting process, please send a request to our Employee Services Center at hrops@fredhutch.org or by calling    206-667-4700 .

company: Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc.
job_Description: Embedded in a worldwide network Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America continuously strives to remain at the forefront of successful automotive research and development. MBRDNA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with key areas of Autonomous Driving, Advanced Interaction Design, Digital User Experience, Machine Learning, Customer Research, and Open Innovation. In Redford, Michigan, the focus is on Powertrain and eDrive technology as well as in Long Beach, where the teams test durability of the latest driver assistant and telematic systems. The Digital Hub in Seattle focusses on developing a cloud architecture and building out the cloud platform for the next generation of connected car services. The Testing and Regulatory Affairs Division in Ann Arbor and the Advanced Vehicle Design in Carlsbad complete the competence center.                  Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America (MBRDNA) is a place for exceptional people with outstanding ideas and the absolute willingness to bring them to life. With R&D facilities all over the U.S., you will be surrounded by engineers, software developers, and designers pushing technology boundaries to shape the future of our industry. We are not just about cars: we are also about the latest and greatest software, cutting-edge technology, and groundbreaking innovation.                  Here at MBRDNA, you create a digital ecosystem around cars, you design a language between humans and machines, you make a car even more intelligent - you make the new reality for cars. We have an open and flexible environment to allow you to push boundaries and actively change the experience for millions of drivers around the world.                  As a member of the management team of the Cloud & Connectivity division of MBRDNA, the person who fills this role will manage 5-10 software developers. The team will be responsible for developing, maintaining, supporting, and testing complex cloud-based infrastructure and services that provide features and value to millions of drivers around the world. Depending on the use cases supported, these services may have thousands of transactions per minute, complex business logic, multiple-9 uptime requirements, etc. The team and the manager will be required to be a member of a 24/7 on-call rotation so the software can be supported in all markets world-wide.                           All teams within Cloud & Connectivity interact and collaborate with development teams in India, Germany, and China.                            Job Responsibilities:             Hire, lead, instruct, support, and coach individual team members to create and maintain an innovative, friendly, inclusive, and challenging work environment.  Drive a culture of agile, scalable, maintainable, and frugal infrastructure, automation and software development within the team  Be an active participant in technical design and architecture decisions  Manage and supervise contractors and/or interns as required  Build and maintain relationships with business sponsors in Germany and the US  Partner with the Product Owners and align on technical feasibility of features and their delivery dates  Create and execute on a product vision that is aligned with stakeholders, sponsors, and product owners  Set and enforce quality gates for all products using data-driven methods  Support the team during on-call duties  Deliver reports and feedback to local and German management. Organize meetings and taskforces as required  Research and implement innovative solutions to improve products and development environment  Be an active member of the Cloud & Connectivity management team                          Minimum Qualifications:             Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field, or equivalent experience  8+ years’ experience with back-end service oriented development, cloud infrastructure, or infrastructure as code (IaC) automation  Software infrastructure design and architecture skills capable of sparking consideration of alternative views amongst senior developers  Experienced in effectively mentoring team members  Adept computer science fundamentals  Previous experience (1+ years) in a leadership position (e.g. manager, team lead, or architect) within a software development, infrastructure or SRE team  Work within a local team as well as collaborate with numerous international teams  Organize, develop, and lead an agile team practicing DevOps  Quickly understand and assimilate business vision and goals in all solutions and translate technical information to teams  Ability to multi-task and effectively function in an interrupt-driven high visibility environment  Excellent analytical & problem solving skills  Ability to innovate and be creative  Solve problems and have the tenacity to drive issues to conclusion  Proficient written and verbal skills and ability to collaborate with colleagues from a wide range of job functions  Some domestic and international travel will be required (less than 15%)                          Preferred Qualifications:             7-10 years of experience recommended  2+ years of CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) pipeline process experience in development and production environments  Understanding of DevSecOps methodologies  Prior knowledge of networking or mobile networks a plus but not necessary  German language skill is a plus but not necessary                          Why should you apply?                       Here at MBRDNA, you create digital ecosystems around cars, you design a language between humans and machines, you make a car even more intelligent - you make the new reality for cars. Our benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k savings plan, tuition and fitness reimbursement programs and much more. We have an open and flexible environment to allow you to push boundaries, join MBRDNA and design your future.                      MBRDNA is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.                      MBRDNA only accepts resumes from approved agencies who have a valid Agency Agreement on file. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, MBRDNA employees, or send to any MBRDNA location. MBRDNA is not responsible for any fees or claims related to receipt of unsolicited resumes.                  Thank you for your interest in Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America. Please be aware the impact of COVID-19 could increase the amount of time it takes our HR and Hiring Team to process your application. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We are dedicated to the health and safety of our employees and candidates. We appreciate your patience during this time.                   Mercedes-Benz Research and Development North America, Inc.                       PRIVACY NOTICE FOR CALIFORNIA RESIDENTS              https://mbrdna.com/california-employee-privacy-notice/

job_title: Sr. Scientist, Antibody Discovery – HT Assays
job_Description: Just is seeking a highly motivated and creative Sr. Scientist that desires a significant opportunity to help invent the technologies required to improve worldwide access to biotherapeutics. This position will be part of a cross-disciplinary team discovering therapeutic antibodies and generating deep data sets for machine learning algorithms. The successful candidate will support the invention, design, and implementation of antibody display libraries, high throughput methodologies and protein structure-function analytics to drive biotherapeutic development. A strong foundation in assay development, cell biology and protein biochemistry is required for this position with additional experience in antibody discovery and automation preferred. This individual must also possess strong communication and collaboration skills, a desire to learn new scientific concepts and domains, and an ability to work directly with scientific staff across multiple disciplines.             Potential Responsibilities:           Develop and implement next generation antibody display libraries for discovery and deep data set generation      Perform mammalian cell culture and stable cell line protein expression for discovery and multiplexed protein analytics      Conceive methods for the determination of protein structure-function relationships in a high-throughput manner      Drive towards the miniaturization of assays while utilizing unpurified protein and DNA material      Devise innovative microfluidics and mixed protein variants assays for the assessment of expression productivity and protein stability      Analyze, organize, summarize, and present data and results at department and project team meetings      Stay informed of science and technology developments in the field and suggest process improvements to team      Maintain a detailed and organized record of experiments in an electronic notebook              Qualifications and Education Requirements:           BS/MS with 10 -15 years of experience or PhD degree with 5-10 years of experience in a life sciences or chemistry discipline      Excellent verbal and written communication skills      Strong focus on quality and attention to detail      Possess effective task/time management organizational skills      Ability to work in small groups as well as independently              Preferred Qualifications:           Experience in antibody discovery processes      Experience with liquid handling automation            Worker

job_title: Chief Data Scientist in Artificial Intelligence
job_Description: Overview:        PNNL is combining profound domain expertise and creative integration of advanced hardware and software to deliver computational solutions that address complex data and analytic challenges.              Working in multidisciplinary teams, PNNL connects research and engineering to operations, providing the tools necessary to innovate quickly and field results faster. Our strengths are integrated across the data analytics lifecycle, from data acquisition and management, to analysis and decision support.    Responsibilities:        Do you want to create a legacy of meaningful research for the greater good? Do you want to lead and contribute to work in support of an organization that addresses some of today’s most challenging problems that face our Nation? Join us in the Data Sciences and Analytics Group at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL), and shape the future today!              We seek a world-class expert in Artificial Intelligence research who brings a wealth of domain expertise and experience solving multi and transdisciplinary problems with national and international impact. This position requires thought leadership and technical depth to support the sponsors of PNNL’s National Security Directorate in the development and advancement of data science and artificial intelligence research. Research of interest includes developing, implementing, and resulting analyses of national security capabilities related to remote sensing, human language technologies, computer vision, image/video understanding, and other related fields.              The Chief Data Scientist in Artificial Intelligence should have the following attributes:           Experience in successfully building and executing AI programs requiring interactions with Government, military, academic, and industry officials nationwide for a variety of programs, projects, and tasks, including technical and programmatic concept development, planning, coordination, integration, and execution that can be supported by data science and deep learning techniques.      Experience applying machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques to domain-specific applications, such as natural language processing, remote-sensing and geo-spatial intelligence, social computing, time series prediction, computer vision, etc.      Familiar with existing deep learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Caffe2) and machine learning packages (i.e., sklearn).      Ability to contribute that knowledge to the academic and research strength of PNNL and have experience writing scientific publications demonstrating their insight and discovery (e.g., publication in conferences such as NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, ACL, ICWSM, EMNLP, NAACL, EACL, COLING, and SIGIR is preferred).     Qualifications:        Minimum Qualifications:           BS/BA with 9 years of experience      MS/MA with 7 years of experience      PhD with 5 years of experience            Hazardous Working Conditions/Environment:        Not Applicable    Additional Information:        Requirements:           U.S. Citizenship      Background Investigation: Applicants selected will be subject to a Federal background investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified matter in accordance with 10 CFR 710, Appendix B.      Drug Testing: All Security Clearance positions are Testing Designated Positions, which means that the candidate selected is subject to pre-employment and random drug testing. In addition, applicants must be able to demonstrate non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for the 12 consecutive months preceding completion of the requisite Questionnaire for National Security Positions (QNSP).           Note: Applicants will be considered ineligible for security clearance processing by the U.S. Department of Energy until non-use of illegal drugs, including marijuana, for 12 months can be demonstrated.    Testing Designated Position (TDP):        This position is a Testing Designated Position (TDP). The candidate selected for this position will be subject to pre-employment and random drug testing for illegal drugs, including marijuana, consistent the Controlled Substances Act and the PNNL Workplace Substance Abuse Program.    About PNNL:        Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is a world-class research institution powered by a highly educated, diverse workforce committed to the values of Integrity, Creativity, Collaboration, Impact, and Courage. Every year, scores of dynamic, driven people come to PNNL to work with renowned researchers on meaningful science, innovations and outcomes for the U.S. Department of Energy and other sponsors; here is your chance to be one of them!           At PNNL, you will find an exciting research environment and excellent benefits including health insurance, flexible work schedules and telework options. PNNL is located in eastern Washington State—the dry side of Washington known for its stellar outdoor recreation and affordable cost of living. The Lab’s campus is only a 45-minute flight (or ~3 hour drive) from Seattle or Portland, and is serviced by the convenient PSC airport, connected to 8 major hubs.    Commitment to Excellence, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Equal Employment Opportunity:        Our laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment dedicated to solving critical challenges in fundamental sciences, national security, and energy resiliency. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. In support of this commitment, we encourage people of all racial/ethnic identities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment.              Pacific Northwest National Laboratory considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status, and any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local laws.                    We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures and in employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at hr@pnnl.gov.    Drug Free Workplace:        PNNL is committed to a drug-free workplace supported by Workplace Substance Abuse Program (WSAP) and complies with federal laws prohibiting the possession and use of illegal drugs.

At Microsoft, we are continuing to expand our efforts in artificial intelligence with a focus on building an Intelligent Cloud and Intelligent Edge. The Artificial Intelligence and Research (AI+R) division is chartered with ensuring that Microsoft remains at the forefront of AI technologies.              As a new and fast-growing team within this organization, we are applying our best AI research and engineering capabilities to new customer solutions in areas of physical autonomous systems (http://aka.ms/as).              Our vision is to lead the autonomous systems tidal wave, empowering intelligence within drones, robots, industrial control systems, etc. Our cloud-based solution encompasses components involving intelligence and simulation, including realistic 3D models of physical world.              We are looking for a passionate engineer to join our team and lead our efforts in incorporating machine learning techniques in lifecycle of autonomous systems (including building, training, simulating, managing, etc.) This includes use of machine learning to build realistic worlds, enable higher level semantics like object detection and classification as well to build physics engines, sensors, etc. The role also provides an opportunity to experience and influence related areas like computer vision.              This is a new business area and team members will have an opportunity to work closely with early customers as we define the product, refine its features, and generalize it to support many vertical industries.              #BusinessAI       Responsibilities         Build Machine Learning models for autonomous systems.      Utilize latest developments in Machine Learning for implementing sensors and controllers.      Utilize machine learning techniques for creating realistic and accurate 3D worlds.      Investigate and enable sim-to-real transitions.      Work in close partnership with internal and external teams of diverse and talented peers of various disciplines.           Qualifications        Required Qualifications              Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related degree, or equivalent work experience      Industry Experience with building machine learning models using frameworks like TensorFlow and/or PyTorch and deploying them            Preferred Qualifications              Experience with applying machine learning techniques to problems in simulation engines and 3D data (sensors, physics engines, object detection, etc.).      2+ years professional development experience in C/C++, Python or Java.      Passion for autonomous systems and related areas.      Good interpersonal skills      Strong creative problem solving and algorithm development skills.      Self-motivated and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment.            Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.              Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

The era of cloud-based enterprise attacks has arrived. Nobelium, the nation state actor behind the 2020 SolarWinds cyberattack, shined a spotlight on how attackers will try to abuse cloud-based identity, applications, data, and services to gain access to enterprises including their emails and documents. This new security frontier demands new defenses, customer solutions, and visionary leadership. This is where you come in.              The Security, Compliance, Identity, and Management Research team is hiring a research manager to own cloud protection strategy across Microsoft 365 Defender (M365D), Microsoft Defender for Office (MDO), Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps (MDA), App Governance (AppG), and Insider Risk (IRM). This M2 role involves leading multiple teams in discovering and building cloud-related security tradecraft, developing prevention/detection/response capabilities across Microsoft enterprise security products, and applying machine learning and AI at unprecedented security scale and impact.              If you are passionate about leading world class security researchers to solve some of the most critical, complex, and challenging security problems, we would love to talk to you!       Responsibilities         Responsibilities:            Lead multiple teams of strong researchers, data scientists, and engineers to deliver prevention, detection, and response capabilities across M365D, MDO, MDA, AppG, and IRM      Direct the team in the discovery and prioritization of cloud-based attacker tradecraft via internal development, engagement with the external security research community, and defense during real-world incidents      Scale product, researcher, Security Operation Center (SOC) capabilities through AI and expert systems      Develop and grow the people manager capabilities of your direct reports through leadership, coaching, modeling, and mentoring      Partner with product and engineering leaders throughout the organization to deliver new product features and capabilities      Attract, grow, and retain world class researcher talent        Qualifications         Required Qualifications:               Bachelor’s Degree in a technical field or related experience      Knowledge and understanding of attacker tradecraft demonstrated through red/blue team operations, published security research, or security product research and development, preferably in a cloud-based context      3+ years of proven team leadership and people management experience      Excellent interpersonal skills and effective written/verbal communication skills, with experience presenting to senior-business leaders      Excellent cross-group collaboration, with the ability to articulate the business need and purpose for engineering changes      Experience leading or developing machine learning-based cybersecurity solutions highly desirable           #scmred #scmrjobs #scmjobs #scmldr              Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form.              Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

job_title: Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, Input, Augmented Reality
job_Description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:    Seattle, WA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA .    Minimum qualifications:          Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.      5 years of experience with software development in C or C++ and with data structures/algorithms.      3 years of experience testing, maintaining, or launching software products, and 1 year of experience with software design and architecture.      Experience with communication protocols and bare-metal or RTOS-based microcontroller development.             Preferred qualifications:          Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.      3 years of experience working with embedded operating systems.      1 year of experience in a technical leadership role.      Experience developing accessible technologies.      Experience designing and developing for multiprocessor systems on a chip, and experience with performance analysis and optimization, in the domains of embedded systems or machine learning.      Experience with of one or more of the following: microcontrollers, SoC, DSP, device drivers, hardware bringup, power management, ARM processors, firmware, or hardware/software integration, bluetooth, WiFi, and other networking technologies.            About the job      Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.    With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.       The Google Augmented Reality (AR) team is a group of engineers, designers, and research scientists tasked with building the foundations for great immersive computing and prototyping helpful, delightful user experiences. We're focused on making immersive computing accessible to many of people through mobile devices, as our scope continues to grow and evolve.      In this role, you will lead the design and develop an input framework for an embedded, real-time platform that will form the foundation for next-generation AR experiences. You will be responsible for overall input device software for an innovative AR device.      Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Devices & Services team combines the best of Google AI, Software, and Hardware to create radically helpful experiences for users. We research, design, and develop new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, seamless, and more powerful. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, the Devices & Services team is making people's lives better through technology.            Responsibilities           Architect, design, and develop an user input framework on an embedded, real-time platform that spans embedded central processing unit, microcontroller unit, digital signal processor, and custom peripherals.       Write robust, reliable, efficient, and testable low-level software to interface with sensors and image signal processors (ISPs) over I2C and serial peripheral interface.       Lead implementation and design, communicate regularly with stakeholders, and shape the agenda for your team.       Work closely with the software teams that are the consumers of our input data to ensure their requirements are being met.       Work closely with hardware teams and external vendors to deeply understand the sensor, ISP, and encoder capabilities and how to optimize for them and collaborate with hardware, research, and machine learning teams to deliver an exceptional user input experience.         Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Position Overview:     We are looking for a skilled Software Test Engineer to join our Quality Assurance team. As a Software Test Engineer, you will be responsible for evaluating software functions and designing test protocols to ensure products work as intended. You will also be responsible for completing all testing procedures, suggesting performance changes, writing defect reports in a clear and concise manner, and tracking defects through the defect cycle.     To ensure success as a Software Test Engineer, you should have knowledge of software design and engineering, a good eye for detail, and a natural gift for software troubleshooting. A skilled Software Test Engineer should be able to identify flaws in software designs and suggest effective fixes.     Responsibilities:         Meeting with development to discuss software specifications and use cases.      Using the software to analyze its functional properties.      Designing manual and automated test procedures to evaluate each software product.      Building, coding, and implementing software test programs.      Tweaking the software testing systems for maximum performance.      Assists in test planning and testing procedures.      Report test results and enter defects into the defect reporting system. Monitor and update defect reports as needed including defect closure.      Configure necessary hardware and operating environments as needed to complete assigned testing.        Requirements:         Bachelor’s degree in computer science or similar field or equivalent experience.      Proven work experience as a Software Test Engineer.      In-depth knowledge of software testing tools. Experience with automated testing tools preferred.      Experience working with Windows operating systems.      Strong attention to detail.      Good understanding of software development life cycle.      Excellent troubleshooting skills.      Ability to design and write complex software testing procedures.      Demonstrated ability to work independently to achieve desired results.        Due to COVID-19, all positions at Beyond Limits are currently remote. However, once our offices are fully reopened, most work is expected to be performed in-person at office in Tacoma, WA.     About Beyond Limits  Beyond Limits is a pioneering Artificial Intelligence engineering company creating advanced software solutions that go beyond conventional AI. Founded in 2014 with a legacy in space exploration, Beyond Limits is transforming proven technologies from Caltech and NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory into advanced AI solutions, hardened to industrial strength, and put to work for forward-looking companies on earth. We leverage this unparalleled innovation portfolio, along with proprietary cognitive technologies, to help companies solve tough, complex, mission-critical problems and transform their business. We apply a unique hybrid approach to AI, combining numeric AI techniques like machine learning with higher order symbolic AI and expert human knowledge to deliver intuitive cognitive reasoning and information. Our cognitive computing technology mimics human thought processes and provides explainable reasoning to aid human-like decision-making.     Beyond Limits provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Beyond Limits complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.    Beyond Limits expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Beyond Limit’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.

Job no:  508222  Position Type:  Staff  Location:  Burlington, MA Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location, Charlotte, NC Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location, Portland, ME Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location, San Francisco, CA Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location, San Jose, CA Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location, Seattle, WA Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location, Washington, DC Campus - Eligible for Alternative Work Location  Categories:  Kostas Research Institute   About Northeastern:  Founded in 1898, Northeastern is a global research university and the recognized leader in experience-driven lifelong learning. Our world-renowned experiential approach empowers our students, faculty, alumni, and partners to create impact far beyond the confines of discipline, degree, and campus.  Our locations—in Boston; Charlotte, North Carolina; London; Portland, Maine; San Francisco; Seattle; Silicon Valley; Toronto; Vancouver; and the Massachusetts communities of Burlington and Nahant—are nodes in our growing global university system. Through this network, we expand opportunities for flexible, student-centered learning and collaborative, solutions-focused research.  Northeastern’s comprehensive array of undergraduate and graduate programs— in a variety of on-campus and online formats—lead to degrees through the doctorate in nine colleges and schools. Among these, we offer more than 195 multi-discipline majors and degrees designed to prepare students for purposeful lives and careers.   About the Opportunity:  The Kostas Research Institute (KRI), on Northeastern University’s Innovation Campus in Burlington, MA (ICBM), focuses on research and applications to national security challenges. Our diverse geospatial AI initiatives and prototype development have a current focus on force readiness and force protection to drive geospatial data to decisions and action. We work in cross-functional teams, exploring how geospatial data, data science, AI/deep learning, computer vision, and customer needs can create new products and insights. Diverse problems require a diverse group of minds. We are seeking a talented, motivated Computer Vision Scientist /Engineer to join our growing team and collaborate with other engineers, coops, PhDs, and Professors as well as work independently. As a member of our technical staff, you’ll be working in our private cloud and/or Azure to ingest a wide variety of data, run advanced machine learning algorithms, and apply data science principles to understand the digital world by building computer-vision-backed APIs on top of data.   For superior candidates, we may consider options for remote work. Proximity to our satellite campus locations is preferred (Burlington MA, Seattle WA, and Arlington, VA).   Responsibilities:  Responsibilities:   Develop, adapt, and extend KRI’s CV and ML/AI technology  Develop new CV and ML models for 2- and 3-D satellite, CubeSat, aerial and ground data sources  Optimize neural networks and associated preprocessing code to run efficiently on large amounts of geospatial data  Improve existing CV models for higher precision and recall metrics, with keen interest in statistical behavior of data and algorithms  Comprehend and contribute to all aspects of ML from data ingestion, storage, indexing, transformations, training, inference etc.  Deploy models in our high-performance computing environment through collaboration with extended team.  Iterate algorithms to continuously improve performance under a variety of conditions  Participate in small and tactical development teams using agile development principles, sprint planning, and standups etc.  Participate in customer meetings to present and discuss technical plans and milestones   Qualifications:   MS (or Bsc) degree, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (physics, mathematics, computer science, operations research, etc.)  1-5 years research experience  Ability to communicate complex data science concepts and results in an understandable manner  Demonstrable examples working with image data and noisy datasets that may have sparsity in some dimension (e.g., spatially, temporally)  Excellent coding skills (especially python with a solid familiarity with NumPy, SciPy, pandas)  Experience with git, GitHub, Docker, and Unix/Linux  Example(s) of designed and trained CV models  Dedication to continuous integration and testing  Experience with LiDAR a plus  Excellent communication and mentoring skills   Preferred Qualifications:  Salary Grade:   Additional Information:    Northeastern University is an equal opportunity employer, seeking to recruit and support a broadly diverse community of faculty and staff. Northeastern values and celebrates diversity in all its forms and strives to foster an inclusive culture built on respect that affirms inter-group relations and builds cohesion.  All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.  To learn more about Northeastern University’s commitment and support of diversity and inclusion, please see  www.northeastern.edu/diversity .
