6 month contract position, up for renewal based on funding and performance   Prefer candidates local to Seattle, WA   Job Description :   Perform microarray, NGS, and single cell NGS data analysis for developing / testing gene expression based diagnostic assays. Build and test diagnostic models that integrate gene expression data with physiological data. Create and verify the integrity of clinical line data files. Programming ability in R required. Solid background in statistics and bioinformatics analysis required. Prior experience with mining and designing clinical databases either using Medrio, MS Access or other relational databases like PostgreSQL/ sqlite would be valued.   Key responsibilities and accountabilities:    1. Perform NGS, microarray and single cell sequencing analysis in R to evaluate the performance of diagnostic signatures.   2. Perform data mining of public and private clinical databases relevant to Sepsis research. Build and test diagnostic models by integrating gene expression biomarkers with physiological data.   3. High throughput computing using the Amazon EC2 framework.   4. Creating and verifying the integrity of clinical line data files.   Key qualifications:    1. Microarray and NGS data analysis experience. Analysis of single cell NGS data helpful.   2. Machine learning using Naïve Bayes, Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) and other approaches to develop improved classifiers based on training and validation patient data.   3. High performance computing experience on distributed computing clusters.   4. Ability to contribute to the writing of research publications in peer-review journals.   5. Educational qualifications:   a. PhD in Bioinformatics/ Biostatistics with prior experience with clinical data management. Exceptional candidates with MS and relevant work experience will also be considered.   b. R programming experience   c. Experience in database design and mining clinical databases using either Medrio, MS Access or PostgreSQL/ SQLite would be a plus.   Desirable traits and skills:    · Map well to chemistry and cultural fit of the IXP team.   · Drive, take initiative and motivated to see programs to completion.   · Emotional maturity and ability to adapt to a changing environment where the structure may evolve rapidly.   · Strong work ethic and desire to be part of a dynamic and fast-moving team   · Able to work in a fast-paced environment within timelines in an assertive young company with a willingness to do "whatever it takes".   · A team player who will promote cooperation in all functional areas and discourage divisiveness.   · Good listening skills and an ability to identify and solve problems   · Excellent written and verbal communication (e.g., comfortable communicating with scientists, clinicians, technicians about high level technical information).   · Able to work in an environment where sharing responsibility for success and failure is critical to overall success.   Job Types: Full-time, Contract, Temporary   Pay: $60,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year   Schedule:      8 hour shift     Education:      Bachelor's (Preferred)     Experience:      R: 1 year (Preferred)    Bioinformatics: 1 year (Preferred)    PostgreSQL: 1 year (Preferred)     Work Location: One location

Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research or a related quantitative field     5+ years of hands-on experience in Applied machine learning, Predictive modeling and analysis     Strong algorithm development experience     Skills with Python, R or other scripting language, as well as Java, C++, or other programming language     Demonstrated ability to effectively deal with ambiguity and deliver results     Strong communication and data presentation skills     Experience leading a science team, establishing direction and identifying the appropriate application of mathematical modeling systems to operations or other industrial applications     Job summary   On the Fulfillment AI Team we work on a variety of problems within our Amazon Fulfillment Centers. We operate at a nexus of machine learning, computer vision, robotics, and healthy measure of hard-earned expertise in operations to build automated, algorithmic approaches to solving these problems. We create cutting edge software, building automated processes and workflows in the most complex operational problem space in the business world. Our solutions drive new system capabilities with global impact.      We're looking for an applied science manager to join our team and help us continue to grow.        Major responsibilities:          Lead a team of scientists and program managers using machine learning, data mining and statistical techniques to create new, scalable solutions for business problems     Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of Amazon’s historical business data to help automate and optimize key processes     Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for predictive learning     Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation     Research and implement novel machine learning and statistical approaches     Identify combined hardware/software solutions to problems in the physical operations space     Key job responsibilities         Lead a team of scientists and program managers uisng machine learning, data mining and statistical techniques to create new, scalable solutions for business problems     Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of Amazon’s historical business data to help automate and optimize key processes     Design, develop and evaluate highly innovative models for predictive learning     Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes for large scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation     Research and implement novel machine learning and statistical approaches     Identify combined hardware/software solutions to problems in the physical operations space     About the team   The Fulfillment AI (FAI) Team is an applied science team under Amazon Fulfillment Technologies (AFT). Our team of scientists work on research projects, developing prototypes which lead to production systems that enhance, optimize, and automate processes in our Fulfillment Centers (FCs). We influence each stage of innovation from inception to deployment and may develop novel solutions or improvements to existing approaches. Resulting production systems rely on a diverse set of technologies, foremost of which are computer vision and machine learning, but also included are statistics, mathematical optimization, ad forecasting. Our team therefore invests in multiple specialties as the needs of each focus area evolve.            7+ years of relevant experience in industry and/or academia.     A strong track record of innovating through machine learning and statistical algorithms and their applications.     Experience with Computer Vision techniques and applications     Strong demonstrated skills implementing and deploying large scale machine learning applications and tools     Experience solving advanced problems in computer vision, metrology, neural networks, and operations research approaches     Experience working on combined hardware/software solutions to solve complex operational problems at industrial scale     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

job_title: Scientist II, Data Analysis & Algorithm Development (R-101332)
job_Description: Who We Are:  NanoString Technologies (NASDAQ: NSTG) is a leading provider of life science tools for discovery and translational research. The company's nCounter® Analysis System is used in life sciences research and has been cited in more than 3,800 peer-reviewed publications. The nCounter Analysis System offers a cost-effective way to easily profile the expression of hundreds of genes, proteins, miRNAs, or copy number variations, simultaneously with high sensitivity and precision, facilitating a wide variety of basic research and translational medicine applications. The company's GeoMx® Digital Spatial Profiler enables highly multiplexed spatial profiling of RNA and protein targets in a variety of sample types, including FFPE tissue sections. Built on pioneering principles in 2003, NanoString is blazing new trails and exploring new frontiers to adapt to the everchanging landscape and becoming smarter and more innovative in the process. We are dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and providing solutions that can have a meaningful impact in research and discovery.  Our purpose is to  Map the Universe of Biology.  We enable scientists to answer questions they have always wanted to ask to explore the boundaries of cellular structures and create an atlas of biological interactions that define life. We are relentless in our quest to  Catalyze the Next Biological Revolution  leading to  Advancing the Human Condition.  In addition to a pioneering spirit, we value:  Grit. Authenticity. Ambition. Ingenuity. Customers . Join our team!   Job Summary: NanoString is seeking an innovative Scientist to join our Research and Development group. In this role the successful applicant will develop software needed for new genomic tools in the field of Spatial Biology. The position is focused on analyzing data acquired from integrated platforms developed at NanoString. The work is highly interdisciplinary and will involve working closely with scientists, instrumentation engineers, and other software engineers. Strong verbal and written communication skills will be essential for collaborating with team members and for working across departments within the company.   Essential Responsibilities:   Develop advanced image processing and data analysis algorithms  Design, adapt and implement software to support a dynamic, fast-moving R&D environment  Work with an interdisciplinary team of hardware engineers, software developers, and life scientists to deliver experimental results  Support the software development process from R&D prototyping through commercialization   Qualifications   Linear Algebra/Systems-Theory math  2-5 years of experience developing software in the life sciences using C#, C/C++, and/or Java  Ph.D. in applied mathematics, physics, computer science, electrical engineering, or a relevant field. Additional experience required for candidates with a M.S. or B.A.  Numerical analysis of multi-dimensional data  Rapid prototype development to support internal, scientific projects  Ability to work both independently and in close collaboration with a core team   Preferred Qualifications:   Image processing: Image segmentation, cell classification, mathematical morphology, pattern recognition, and image registration  Fluorescence microscopy, multi-channel (5+) imaging, and multiplexed encoding  Statistical data analysis methods such as clustering, and unmixing algorithms for diffraction limited and larger features  Digital pathology, bioinformatics, machine learning, computer vision and neural networks  Parallel computing  Python, MATLAB, OpenCV, GIT, Visual Studio, Azure DevOps, .NET NanoString is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. NanoString does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that it does not have a signed agreement with.  COVID-19 VACCINATION REQUIREMENT: NanoString has a COVID-19 vaccination policy that applies to ALL U.S. employees (regardless of work location), onsite contractors and visitors except as prohibited by applicable law. As a condition of employment, newly hired employees are required to provide proof of full vaccination within 31 days of their hiring date or have applied for an exemption for which an accommodation can be made. Being fully vaccinated means that an individual is at least two weeks past their final (or only) dose of an authorized COVID-19 vaccine regimen. Exemptions will be considered for medical conditions/disabilities and sincerely held religious beliefs, observations, or practices. For any visitor coming onsite to one of NanoString's facilities, we must verify that the visitor is fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to site entry and visitors must don a face mask at all times when onsite in a NanoString facility.    Accommodations  If you require assistance or accommodation when applying for open positions please contact recruiting@nanostring.com.

System1 is looking for a Senior Technical Project Manager to join our Data Platform team. This team is the horizontal layer that supports business intelligence, optimization, machine learning, and external & internal reporting. We process and report on hundreds of millions of events and user attributes per day, gathered from an extremely heterogeneous and large set of data streams.   The Technical Project Manager is responsible for planning, scheduling, and executing technical projects. They will own the cross-department communication with all stakeholders including the engineering teams, operations teams and business development teams. On a day-to-day basis the Technical Project Manager will be hands-on with the product & engineering teams, ensuring that we are on the right track to achieve the established milestones.   What You Can Expect on the Team      Work closely with the product and engineering teams to evaluate, review and analyze the roadmap and requirements to plan the delivery schedules and cadence    Manage communications with all the stakeholders to keep them informed around status, timelines, and obstacles throughout the project lifecycle    Initiate conversations around project risks, and actively seek out means of resolution    Gather qualitative and quantitative data to the engineering team’s capacity, and manage the velocity to achieve the highest level of competency as a team    Implement continuous improvements to our project management processes     What You Will Bring      Demonstrated experience in a software development organization as a Technical Project Manager    Experience managing projects across cross functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules    Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or related technical field    Project management formal certifications (PMP, PMgP, CSM etc)     What We Have to Offer      Competitive PTO    11 Company Holidays    Untracked sick time    100% covered Medical, Dental, Vision for employees    401k w/match    Paid professional development    Leadership & growth opportunities    Virtual company and team building events    #BI-Remote    #LI-Remote     Job Type: Full-time

Diversity - Diversity makes us a better organization and team. We value diverse backgrounds, ideas, and experiences. company: Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America, Inc.
job_Description: Embedded in a worldwide network Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America continuously strives to remain at the forefront of successful automotive research and development. MBRDNA is headquartered in Silicon Valley, California, with key areas of Autonomous Driving, Advanced Interaction Design, Digital User Experience, Machine Learning, Customer Research, and Open Innovation. In Redford, Michigan, the focus is on Powertrain and eDrive technology as well as in Long Beach, where the teams test durability of the latest driver assistant and telematic systems. The Digital Hub in Seattle focusses on developing a cloud architecture and building out the cloud platform for the next generation of connected car services. The Testing and Regulatory Affairs Division in Ann Arbor and the Advanced Vehicle Design in Carlsbad complete the competence center.                  This center is responsible for innovative software development for the global brand with a focus on highly available APIs and services leveraging cloud technologies. While this center is serving the US market directly, the product produced will be launched internationally, impacting the lives of millions of people.                  Team lead will guide a team in the end-to-end development and operational support of applications used by millions of people and cloud based services that will enhance their experiences. Design and deliver core software features and services, establish development and operational processes, coach team members and coordinate with internationally distributed design and development teams.                    Job Responsibilities:             Design, delivery and support of software based products and services  Maintenance and migration of pre-existing systems  Management and mentoring of team of software engineers and operations engineers  Coordination with overall site leader  Assist with recruiting and hiring                          Minimum Qualifications:             Computer science or related degree  8+ year of overall experience  1+ years of leadership  Solid experience with cloud based service development  Extensive experience in building, deploying and managing large distributed applications  Experience with Agile development methodologies  Experience with DevOps, CI/CD processes & tools                          Preferred Qualifications:             Experience in hiring  Ability to set and manage project milestones  Ability to lead a team in large cross-functional projects  Experience with operational support of consumer facing cloud based services  Strong network in Seattle technology community                          Why should you apply?                       Here at MBRDNA, you create digital ecosystems around cars, you design a language between humans and machines, you make a car even more intelligent - you make the new reality for cars. Our benefits include medical, dental and vision insurance, 401k savings plan, tuition and fitness reimbursement programs and much more. We have an open and flexible environment to allow you to push boundaries, join MBRDNA and design your future.                      MBRDNA is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce.                      MBRDNA only accepts resumes from approved agencies who have a valid Agency Agreement on file. Please do not forward resumes to our applicant tracking system, MBRDNA employees, or send to any MBRDNA location. MBRDNA is not responsible for any fees or claims related to receipt of unsolicited resumes.                  Thank you for your interest in Mercedes-Benz Research & Development North America. Please be aware the impact of COVID-19 could increase the amount of time it takes our HR and Hiring Team to process your application. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. We are dedicated to the health and safety of our employees and candidates. We appreciate your patience during this time. Job Description     Nordstrom is reinventing the retail industry through the power of data and artificial intelligence. The vision for Data Science & Analytics at Nordstrom is to be the best data-driven fashion retailer in the world, and we win by being relevant to the customer through an application of insight and prediction to outcomes.        The Data Analyst 3 role on the Strategic Analytics team is responsible for collecting, analyzing and presenting data to improve decision making for senior management. This individual should have a high degree of curiosity about the business and the skills to discover impactful insights from data. They should be able to communicate those insights in a way that builds confidence and enables decisions that drive business value.     We are part of the Nordstrom’s centralized Data Science and Analytics team with a focus on supporting executive management with robust decision support data science. Here we build data science products and provide analytics consulting in support of strategic business decisions, in areas such as, omni channel, customer care, digital operations, digital merchandise, supply chain, and digital experience for Nordstrom’s Digital and Styling business. We work as the quantitative right-hand for the executive team with a passion for supporting data-driven decision making, a devotion to advanced techniques, along with a creative team spirit!    The ideal candidate is a creative self-starter and strong technical contributor who is always looking for new opportunities to solve business problems with data-driven tools. We welcome your curiosity about the business, your passion to unlock rich, nuanced insights from complicated data and the desire to communicate those insights in a way that drives positive business outcomes.        We are committed to building teams that reflect the diversity of our customers and active inclusion is core to how Nordstrom wins. We’re an equal opportunity employer and encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply. If the idea to make a difference in this vibrant intersection of fashion, data science, and technology excites you, join our world-class data science team!        A day in the life…         Partner with key stakeholders to define success and develop measurement frameworks      Dive deep into complex business problems and provide insights on merch performance through hypothesis testing      Responsible for delivering a suite of analytical products include analyses, dashboards, insights, and recommendations.      Present the results to the stakeholders up to executive level and guide them to make the best use of analytics in their domain.      Own the definition and implementation of new metrics.      Find opportunities to use data to develop new strategies and improve overall performance.      Deliver high quality solutions and recommendations to a variety of problems both independently and through the collaboration with team members and business partners to      Bring data to life through storytelling in a clear and meaningful way to audiences with mixed levels of technical expertise.      Reconcile divergent demands from multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced work environment.      Mentor more junior team members on analytics, storytelling and communication best practices.      Influence and support the Center of Excellence standards and best practices of analytics.      Use advanced analytical and statistical practices to create thorough and actionable insights.           You own this if you have…         Bachelors Degree in quantitative field (or equivalent experience)      5+ years of professional experience analyzing complex data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations.      3+ years of experience in extracting & manipulating large data sets from various relational databases using SQL (Amazon Redshift, Oracle, Teradata preferred).      Strong problem solving skills - Is able to complete ambiguous projects independently & plan out the priority order of tasks; find the right resources to complete the tasks and make smart decisions regarding trade-offs.      Strong coding skills in at least one statistical or programming language (R or Python preferred) to import, summarize, and analyze data.      Experience with statistical and machine learning algorithms (e.g. regression, classification and/or clustering).      Proficiency with graphics/visualization software (e.g. Shiny, ggplot, matplotlib, Tableau).      Ability to be flexible and work in a fast-paced and dynamic organization      Clear and effective written and verbal communication and strong interpersonal skills           You’ll love this Job If You         …are a self-directed individual who operates with passion, urgency, focus, and discipline… put simply, you get-stuff-done.      …have problem solving skills that are unparalleled…you are scrappy and resourceful      …are an adaptable team player. You will enthusiastically take on other assignments as needed to support your team!      …are detailed-oriented with a knack for precision and accuracy in numbers and analyses.      …are someone who appreciates diversity in all it’s forms      …are someone who appreciates a company that values and encourages work-life balance           About Nordstrom     Nordstrom is a specialty retailer offering the very best in fashion and customer service since 1901. We live by five simple values that guide how we work together day-to-day and how we deliver analytics & data science products. We are customer-obsessed, owners at heart, curious and ever-changing, we extend ourselves to our peers and our customers, and we’re here to win! Were proud to be named to Fortune™ magazines list of 100 Best Companies to Work For. We believe this recognition comes from our desire to empower our employees to set their sights high and deliver exceptional service to customers        We’ve got you covered…        Our employees are our most important asset and that’s reflected in our benefits. Nordstrom is proud to offer a variety of benefits to support employees and their families, including:         Medical/Vision, Dental, Retirement and Paid Time Away      Life Insurance and Disability      Merchandise Discount and EAP Resources           A few more important points...        The job posting highlights the most critical responsibilities and requirements of the job. It’s not all-inclusive. Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering or related field.     10+ years of software engineering experience, with a proven track record of leading large-scale projects.     Proven track record of leading the delivery of machine learning focused systems.     Excellent problem-solving skills.     Proven track record of making good technical judgement.     Exceptional communication skills.     Exemplary hands-on practitioner and lead by example     Great at working with the senior leadership within your organization to develop a long-term technical strategy. You map business goals to appropriate technology investments.     This position is in Seattle, Austin, Nashville or Phoenix.      Want to work for a fast-paced, innovative team? Want to work on ground-breaking initiatives? Want to pioneer new ways of staffing one of the largest private employers in history? We are seeking a strong principal engineer who can help unlock some of the most complex problems we are trying to solve.      Workforce Staffing (WFS) is responsible for hiring hourly associates into our global fulfillment operation. Each year we hire hundreds of thousands of associates across the globe. Workforce Intelligence (WFI), a subsidiary of WFS, is responsible for the data acquisition, engineering, research and programmatic insights to help WFS and Amazon scale that staffing to meet customer demand at an improved cost.      The org is seeking a Principal Data Engineer which will lead development of services and data infrastructure at the intersection of machine learning, big data, and distributed systems. Our core technology powers 1000s of users and as we grow the data and services to deliver at scale we need a PE who can enable these mechanisms using modern tools for environment management, data processing, and distributed training. This role will help drive this transformation by working closely with software engineering, BI engineering, data science, and business leaders to ensure stewardship and semantic consistency of data across different business lines. Solutions will include collaborative data modeling, high-level architecture creation, and process design and execution. Both technical excellence and soft influence skills will be vital to success in this role.            Graduate degree in computer science or related field (MS or Ph.D.)     Data-driven and “quantitative” mentality. Grounded, detail-oriented, always backs up ideas with facts     Ability to understand complex application data flows and bridge the gap between technical and business app requirement     Track record of implementing AWS services in a variety of business such as large enterprises and start-ups     2+ years hands-on experience as a Principal Engineer leading multiple data engineering, software engineering or Machine Learning teams

AMS Dataserfs is seeking a talented and motivated individual looking to pursue a career as a Staff Linux Administrator in Mountain View, CA. We are seeking a candidate with experience in Linux server administration at large scale, in highly available environments. You will be working with a team on designing, building, maintaining, and supporting a fast-growing HPC farm of 10,000+ machines, across multiple environments. You will work closely with local and remote IT teams. The basic scope is to maintain and expand the farm, assist developers in preparing and troubleshooting work run on the farm, and provide support to end users who are using the farm. You will need to be familiar with network technologies such as DNS, NFS, DHCP, and LDAP, as well as shell scripting, the X windowing system, and debugging tools such as strace and gdb. An ideal candidate will have experience with software development, familiarity with Tcl, and experience with a job scheduling system such as RTDA NetworkComputer, IBM Spectrum LSF, or Oracle Grid Engine.   Job Description:   Provide administration and support for the HPC job queue, including assisting in debugging user jobs and acting as liaison with third party support. Implementation as well as day to day administration of Linux servers built as virtual machines in Azure or in the local datacenter, Azure storage as well as the surrounding infrastructure including Express Routes (WAN/LAN connectivity). Build EDA toolchain installations and configurations as well as maintenance and development of scripts and tools for automation. Monitor services/servers and troubleshoot issues as they arise. Learning and staying familiar with various tools and applications used on servers (e.g. Perl, Python, EDA tools..). Working with and troubleshooting HPC Linux infrastructure to meet best performance and High Availability. Acute drive to automate manual operations and to improve them through repeated iteration. Managing large numbers of diverse systems with configuration management or software delivery platforms Document issues and associated resolutions to problems. Automate and build best-in-class continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD).   Required Skills:   Linux Server in a large-scale environment with focus on deployment, automation, and large scaled administration. Programing experience in python, Perl, bash shell, GO, or similar scripting languages. Understanding in Networking concept (TCP/IP, subnets, Vlans, LACP, NIC Teaming, unicast/broadcast/multicast, DNS, DHCP, SSH, etc..) Understanding of batch job scheduling technologies: Flowtracer, NetworkComputer, Azure batch. Understanding in Container technology (Docker, kubernetes, singularity, etc…). Experience with source code control server development (Perforce, git). Experience with open source and proprietary cloud and virtualization technologies ( Openstack, Azure) Familiarity with modern software development processes and best practices Knowledge in kubernetes/istio prefered. Experience with documenting procedures. Excellent written and verbal communication skills in the English language Dependable to be at work during assigned shifts and to complete work as expected. Strong initiative and passionate about learning new technologies. Ability to work well with a team in a fast paced, constantly changing environment and follow instructions from supervisors and senior colleagues. Be willing to work with and learn the latest Azure Cloud technologies as they are released and implemented.   Job Type: Full-time   Benefits:      401(k)    Dental insurance    Flexible schedule    Health insurance    Paid time off    Vision insurance     Schedule:      Monday to Friday     Supplemental Pay:      Bonus pay     Experience:      VMWare: 1 year (Preferred)    Linux: 1 year (Preferred)     Security clearance:      Confidential (Preferred)     Work Location: One location

Masters Degree in Economics, Statistics, Finance, Machine Learning, or Operations Research     10+ years of experience in consulting or private sector     Experience in the development and execution of products from concept, prototype to production all while incorporating feedback from customers, scientists, and business leaders     Experience writing technical white papers and business-facing documents to clearly explain complex technical concepts to audiences with diverse business/scientific backgrounds     Demonstrated analytical skills     Ability to identify and solve ambiguous problems.     Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically and tactically in a high-energy, fast-paced environment     Experience hiring and leading experienced scientists and a successful record of developing junior members from academia/industry to a successful career track     Ability to work effectively within an interdisciplinary science team of Data Scientists, Economists, BIE, Applied Scientists, Software Engineers and Data Engineers           Job summary    The Head of Workforce Planning Research & Science in AWS will be responsible the science behind all products, programs, and metrics related to workforce planning and key strategic initiatives across AWS. The person will lead a team to come up with innovative ways to use econometrics, machine learning, and economic theory to improve the experience of AWS employees and to help the organization accelerate AWS’s growth. We are looking for a seasoned leader able to provide structure for the design and execution of a Workforce Planning Research & Science Center of Excellence which will include the sourcing, defining and leveling around complex and varied business problems. We seek a creative thinker who has a desire to execute and deliver on big ideas while building and leading a team of experts.                Key job responsibilities            Manage and grow a high-performing economist/science team (including managers)      Identify and work with external and internal talent data-sets and develop ways to combine the two to answer important talent research questions      Work with AWS HR scientists and leadership to develop research roadmap      Identify and pitch new opportunities to leadership that are suggested by the data      Suggest experiments and mechanisms to quantify the impact of policy changes on talent movement      Build state of the art models to predict employee headcount and movements across all Amazon businesses      Build models to understand drivers of promotion, attrition, transfers, and hires        This role may be based out of any US Global AWS Office including (but not limited to): Dallas, Austin, Chicago, Seattle, Atlanta, Boston, New York, San Francisco, San Diego, Tempe, Pittsburgh, Charlotte, Charleston, Salt Lake City, Nashville, Minneapolis, Detroit        About the team    Our Workforce Planning Research & Science organization focuses on Strategic Design and Demand Planning for the AWS workforce. Our vision is the right person in the right place at the right time for the right cost, now and in the fullness of time. We own the science behind all products, programs, and metrics related to workforce planning and key strategic initiatives across AWS. We come up with innovative ways to use econometrics, machine learning, and economic theory to improve the experience of AWS employees and to help the organization accelerate AWS’s growth.               PhD in Economics, Statistics, Finance, Machine Learning, or Operations Research      Applicants with considerably more experience, including mid-career, are also strongly encouraged.      Strong research track record.      Strong background in econometrics (e.g., forecasting, time series, panel data, program evaluation, and/or high dimensional problems), probability and statistics, economic theory, and quantitative methods      Deep training in theoretical time series along with applied time series experience      Excellent communication (verbal and written) and collaboration skills that enable you to earn trust at all levels      High degree of organization and ability to manage multiple, competing priorities. Summary: We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join IT’s Data Science and AI team. The mission of our team is to enable data driven decisions across Seagen by ensuring that teams have access to the expertise, technology platforms, and reliable, reusable, and cataloged data in a discoverable and timely fashion to support achieving their goals. The Senior Data Scientist will partner with our business teams to perform a thorough analysis of their needs with respect to data science workflows and processes while identifying functional and non-functional requirements for technology or process solutions. Additionally, they will utilize their skill set to develop data pipelines and advanced analytics solutions as needed to support business teams. The role will create a strong partnership with business and technical teams to collaborate on application solutions with respect to value, quality, and end-user experience. Through their work, the Sr. Data Scientist will develop subject matter expertise in how Seagen teams use data, applications, and platform functionality and features. The ideal candidate is adept at manipulating, cleaning, and analyzing large datasets over multiple domains, and is experienced at using a variety of machine learning and other predictive techniques to provide actionable insights. They must be comfortable with ambiguity and able to converse with stakeholders to understand data and business problems. They must also be proficient in one or more programming languages and must have familiarity with software development tools and processes. Responsibilities: Understand user requirements for how data is used to make decisions. Includes process mapping, optimization, and technology enablement Apply strong data science expertise and a systems analysis methodology to help guide solution analysis, working closely with both business and technical teams, with consideration of both technical and non-technical implications and trade-offs Extract data from various data sources; perform exploratory data analysis, cleanse, massage, and aggregate data Design, develop, and maintain large scale data processing pipelines to iteratively provide insights at scale using cloud computing capabilities such as Databricks Use machine learning techniques to build models that address business needs while promoting and advocating for the value of advanced modeling techniques Collaborate cross functionally with other data scientists, statisticians, and business analysts to define business problems and implement scalable solutions Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques Lead and own technical engagement with identified business teams, developing strong partnerships based on trust, transparency, and delivery Help support day to day activities of the data science team’s platforms; this may include creating knowledge base articles, updates to platform manuals and documentation, best practices and guidance, and diagnostics of issues that are raised Organize or lead demos, and user acceptance reviews while working with the technical team on the creation of design documents and artifacts May drive the project management of smaller projects, lead responsibility for analysis work streams within projects of significant size or impact Collaborate with others on the team and business teams to deliver new, innovative solutions to Seagen users by providing thought leadership while participating in Seagen data communities Qualifications: Strong interpersonal and customer relationship skills, including the ability to adjust workstyle and communication to match an audience; across leadership, non-technical teams, and data scientists Ability to communicate to technology savvy customers and a strong understanding of data science workflows, techniques, and technologies Experience performing root cause analysis on a variety of data formats to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement Deep data analysis experience working with both structured and unstructured datasets Familiarity with custom development, open-source products implementation, systems integration and GCP or Azure cloud capabilities Business requirement elicitation techniques, options prioritization and analysis, translation to technical functional and non-functional requirements, solution design, test planning, change management, vendor management Proven experience building processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata management, dependency, and workload management Experience with creating clear solution strategies, policies, procedures, and system documentation Experience with facilitating small teams, guiding work delivery and quality Education: Graduate degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Systems, Informatics, Data Science, or related field As the leading employer in our industry in the Pacific Northwest, Seagen is proud to offer a competitive total compensation package as well as a comprehensive benefits program designed to support the whole lives of our employees and their families. 3-5 years of experience in a relevant technical position.     Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related technical discipline or equivalent experience.     Computer Science fundamentals in data structures, algorithm design, and problem-solving.     Software development or scripting in at least one of the following languages: C++, JavaScript, Rust, Kotlin, Swift, C# .Net, Go, Java     Job summary   The AWS SDKs and Tools team at Amazon.com is looking for passionate and customer obsessed Developer Support Engineers to join a new team focusing on helping AWS customers resolve development questions over GitHub.      Amazon has built a reputation for excellence with recent examples of being named #1 in customer service, #1 most trusted, and #2 most innovative. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is carrying on that tradition while leading the world in Cloud technologies. As a member of the AWS Open Source Support team, you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology, assisting developers around the world that are taking advantage of a growing set of AWS services and features to build their mission-critical applications.      We are looking for developer support engineers that enjoy solving problems, working with customers, and have excellent programming skills in one or more modern programming languages. Our support engineers work with AWS customers on GitHub, Stack Overflow and other developer community sites to help them build on AWS. We are the “voice of the developer” inside AWS and have a strong voice into AWS product teams for recurring issues or feature requests.      A successful candidate will be someone with solid coding skills who is customer focused, and who can multi-task and utilize both written & verbal communication skills to help our diverse range of customers resolve their technical issues.      As a Developer Support Engineer you would typically be involved in the following activities on a day to day basis:         Empower AWS customers who use AWS SDKs such as (but not limited to): Java, .Net, Node.js, PHP, Python, Ruby, Go, and C++, Kotlin, Rust, the AWS CLI and the AWS Tools for Windows PowerShell.     Act as customer’s advocate and represent customer needs to the product development teams.     Raise feature requests on behalf of customers’ use cases.     Ensure timely communication and driving technical issues towards closure.     Raise bug reports.     Write tools/scripts to help the team.     Write tutorials, how-to videos, and other technical articles for the AWS software development community.     Work with leadership on process improvements and strategic initiatives.     ---      AWS has the most services and more features within those services, than any other cloud provider–from infrastructure technologies like compute, storage, and databases–to emerging technologies, such as machine learning and artificial intelligence, data lakes and analytics, and Internet of Things. AWS Platform is the glue that holds the AWS ecosystem together. Whether its Identity features such as access management and sign on, cryptography, console, builder & developer tools, and even projects like automating all of our contractual billing systems, AWS Platform is always innovating with the customer in mind. The AWS Platform team sustains over 750 million transactions per second. job_title: Software Engineering Program Manager, Technology Development Group (TDG) - Seattle
job_Description: Summary  Posted: Apr 27, 2022  Role Number: 200342534  The Technology Development Group is looking for a software engineering project manager (EPM) to help us build the next generation of Augmented Reality (AR) interactive solutions for Apple platforms. This team is working with some of Apple's most advanced technologies including AR, machine learning (ML) and computer vision (CV). As a member of our organization you will lead teams crafting future products that will delight, inspire and empower millions of people. You will need solid experience with system software, proven leadership capabilities, great interpersonal skills, and a dream to work with an amazing team to help guide feature and software development. As a self-motivated teammate who thrives in a dynamic, constantly changing environment, passionate about building phenomenal products and learning new technologies, this is the job for you. We are looking for people with a passion and track record for shipping complex new technology. This is a hands on role where you will lead projects through the software development lifecycle from concept to delivery. You should demonstrate high integrity, high energy and feel comfortable in a dynamic environment. As an experienced change leader navigating uncharted technology advancements you will need to build strong collaborative relationships and calmly manage any associated conflicts along the way. You will be responsible for successful outcomes and delivery with laser focus on execution with a keen eye for important details. If you relish challenge and are excited by working with a great team on amazing new technology, then we want to hear from you - please apply!  Key Qualifications  2+ years of software program or project management experience  Prior experience in hands-on software development is desired  Prior experience and consistent track record leading and shipping multiple complex projects simultaneously  Solid knowledge of software development practices  Experience driving and delivering critical project features which involve integration with multiple different teams  Passion for and proven ability to quickly understand technical concepts  Collaboration: You are able to fit in well with a team, understand capabilities and priorities  Ability to communicate aspects of the project and filter messaging based on the target audience  Ability to create and execute plans in ambiguous settings  A deeply curious mindset about new ideas  Unafraid to ask the hard questions  Description  In this role, you will drive large, cross-functional programs related to user experiences, algorithm development, and/or core operating systems. This requires partnering with engineering management to facilitate all aspects of projects: define, schedule, prioritize, track, proactively manage and communicate status of projects. You will lead efforts across teams representing multiple layers of the software stack as well as other cross-functional partners in areas such as human interface design, hardware, firmware, marketing and other organizations within and outside of Apple. Strong written and verbal communication is key as you drive projects forward, prioritize work, facilitate the removal of obstacles and escalate risks.  Education & Experience  BS/MS, Computer Science / Engineering or relevant industry experience  Additional Requirements

We are Fresh. Together let’s build the future. With partners and clients, we practice strategy, design, development, and engineering to harness the power of technology and create what's next.    Our cross-disciplinary approach blends human ingenuity and technology, empowering us to meet uncertainty with confidence. What got us to today won’t get us to tomorrow, so we test our assumptions and always strive for growth. From the products we build to the partners we collaborate with, we believe people make the difference.    And we do so as a workforce representative of the communities we serve, understanding that a diverse workforce strengthens our organization. We value diversity and support a positive and welcoming environment where all of our employees can thrive.        Who we are:  At Fresh Robotics, we hyper-focus on solving real world problems in novel ways that our customers face. We are a team of robotics engineers who are not only developing solutions for our clients, but also developing a robotics integration and “robotics as a service” platform, to help solve common problems at scale, where robotics and automation is the right answer. Through our creative, technically minded driven spirit, we’re on a mission to become the premier robotics integration partner in the world.        Why join Fresh?  We are tech industry veterans in software, hardware, and design who are pooling our skills to build the future we want to live in. We are solving real-world problems by leveraging robotics, machine learning and computer vision, among other disciplines, with an eye toward the end-to-end user experience. Our team is agile, diverse, and driven. We believe that the best way to solve complicated, dynamic problems is collaboratively and respectfully. Most of all, we were built from the start as a modern, high performance services partner that puts people - from our employees to our partners to our clients to their customers, first.        What we need:  We are looking for a Robotics Director to lead our growing Robotics division here at Fresh. You will capitalize on global market opportunity, create value for customers and position Fresh for success by creating a Robotics and AI practice/ organization by pursuing and delivering on the mission of Empowering people, Saving the planet, and Exploring the universe.  Leads our Robotics Team and has decision-making authority across this team.  Reports to, and partners with Hardware Engineering Director to lead operations health, process, estimation, scheduling, and resource allocation, people issues, project performance, hardware tools, and design reviews.  Partners cross-functionally with Sales, Internal Ops, Finance, HR, and internal Innovation to integrate with related Robotics efforts.        Role Balance:         10% Practice Area strategy, management, & planning      25% People management, mentorship & delivery excellence      50% Program, and project leadership and delivery execution      15% Business development & account key management           Strategy & Growth         Develop robotics discipline ensuring marketing position of capabilities      Develop, manage to and adapt the robotics business plan and strategy as people, market, and company objectives change      Drive YOY robotics practice growth through investment in client, team, and technology while adapting to market and business dynamics      Manage the P&L of the robotics book of work and drive to defined metrics      Conduct, collect and synthesize industry research to formulate long term strategic objectives, plans, and strategy to drive long term growth           Team Leadership         Optimizing Team, Projects, Process, and Tools across the Robotics & Engineering group with overall accountability for Robotics.      As needed, guides PMs and Leads to set goals, plan projects, build a timeline, and stay within budget.      Attract, retain, grow, lead and manage a diverse and inclusive team      Cultivate the growth mindset of our team members and drive a high-performance culture with accountability and extreme ownership      Empower team, develop clarity, generate energy and manage the business      Provide technical guidance to the team in making high impact design choices throughout the development cycles      Collaborate with internal and external team members to plan and execute on key deliverables across the product and client book of work      Drive continuous improvement, adaptation, reflection and growth      Develop safety and quality-driven development culture      Develop improvements to processes and tools that increase team impact      Support and drive company-wide alignment and improvement initiatives           Partners cross-functionally with Sales, Internal Ops, Finance, HR, and internal Innovation to lead related efforts         Collaborates with the sales team to expand our client base and grow into new strategic business sectors (with Bus Dev)      Strengthen and support the existing client base      Support the sales funnel and provide leadership to quote development      Develop new client partnerships and strategic engagement initiatives      Supports the recruiting and hiring process (with HR)      Collaborates with Sales, PMs, and Ops on resource allocation & management, in support of Book of Work prioritization      Advisor for prioritization of client projects & internal initiatives by advising on Book of Work.      Collaborates on internal innovation projects      Focuses on the professional development of the HW leadership group, is aware of team management, and helps promote culture and morale (in collaboration with HR)           Technical Leadership, Client Work         Advisor for architecture, technical project planning, and strategic guidance on engineering implementation and delivery      Contribute to concept, design, and architecture reviews      Define and guide product architecture and engineering development      Develop and connect technical roadmaps to measurable outcomes through a deep understanding of business and innovation goals      Lead through demonstration of design, architecture and engineering best practices      Focuses on removing obstacles from the team that impedes our ability to deliver results against all thresholds (profit, quality, on time, team & client health)      Manage risks related to people, technology and processes      Provide electro-mechanical and software engineering contributions as necessary that conforms to engineering fundamentals and best practices           Required Qualifications:         BS in Mechanical, Electrical, Industrial or Computer Engineering      10+ or more years of IoT/large-scale robotics implementation, operations and/or solution deployment experience in a business-critical, high-availability context      Working knowledge of modern software development practices such as agile methodologies and DevOps      8+ years’ experience in software development, with special emphasis in robotics application development or related technologies      Experience developing software code in one or more programming languages (C,C++,Java, JavaScript, Python, etc)      Current hands-on implementation experience required           Preferred Qualifications:         Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.      Experience in deep reinforcement learning for locomotion and planning control      Experience in IoT, machine learning, robotics      7+ years experience in a customer-facing role      Professional experience architecting systems for real world applications and simulation      Ability to lead effectively across organizations      Working knowledge of ANSI/RIA R15.06-2012, ANSI B56.5-2012      Proficiency with SQL, SolidWorks, MS Project, Visio, Azure DevOps, PowerBI           Equal employment opportunity: All qualified persons will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, familial status, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability for which a reasonable accommodation can be made or any other status protected by law. Assistance will be gladly provided upon request for any applicant with sensory or non-sensory disabilities.            Fresh Consulting is a participating E-Verify company.            YJ6QwtGvUu

JOB SUMMARY: The Senior Project Manager is responsible for the overall planning, management and completion of technical projects, and overall member satisfaction. Works with members and internal business stakeholders to develop project scope of work documents and project plans. Uses project management skills to manage project roles, identify resource requirements, coordinate project training needs, define project deliverables, monitor risk, member satisfaction, and maintain project documentation. Ensures effective communications and relationships between members and OSIS are maintained.                         ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: The responsibilities listed are fundamental to the position and must be performed successfully to achieve the key performance objectives of the role. Other responsibilities may be assigned.                                               Develops and maintains a productive working relationship with project sponsors, vendors and key member contacts.                                Work together with key business partners to gather requirements and create project plans used to successfully deliver IT projects.                                Collaborate with other experts, consultants and IT team members to ensure project deliverables and technology standards are adhered.                                Establish and lead the right communication mechanisms and rhythm with project teams and key stakeholders.                                Creates and executes project work plans (and supporting documentation) and revises as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.                                Participates in regular one on one meetings with manager and in team meetings and effectively communicates project information to OSIS leadership.                Builds, maintains, and leverages member and internal relationships to drive mutually beneficial solutions that create a positive member experience; acts as member liaison to drive project closure and ticket escalation as requested, as well as identify additional needs/wants.         Coordinates with others to identify resources needed and assign individual responsibilities         Manages day-to-day operational aspects of a project and scope, including hosting regular project update meetings.         Reviews deliverables prepared by team before passing to member, consulting with department managers as needed.         Effectively applies project team best practice methodology and enforces project standards.         Minimizes exposure and risk on project, makes management aware of any at risk items, then develop and implement scope and timeline changes.         Actively identifies trends and subtle members needs/wants through member dialog, including regular standing calls.         Maintains up-to-date project / project related documentation of all member requests, concerns or activities including all agendas, meeting minutes, notes or action items from member meetings, calls and other communications.         Identify process improvements that will enhance the member experience and prevent dissatisfaction; assists in resolving escalated issues.         Assists with PMO projects and works with manager on developing best practices, documentation, project plans, etc.         Assists manager and PMO with knowledge sharing and learning sessions for the team.         Reviews member CW Service desk tickets and coordinates resources as needed for timely resolution.         Other duties as assigned.                                                               SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:                    This position has no supervisory responsibilities.                                   WORK ENVOIRNMENT:                           This job operates in a clerical office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, scanners, copy machines and filing cabinets.                                   PHYSICAL DEMANDS:                           This is largely a sedentary role; however, some filing and order cleanup is required. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand as necessary.                                   POSITION TYPE/EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK:                           This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Occasional evening and weekend work may be required as job duties demand.                                   TRAVEL:                                     This position requires less than 10% travel. Employees who work from the corporate office may telecommute on an as needed basis.                                       Must have:                                         Cable or Fiber Internet Service             Download speed of 20Mbps or higher             Upload speed of 5Mbps or higher                                                                OTHER DUTIES:                              Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.
