job_title: Senior Manager Machine Learning - Customer Personalization
job_Description: About the team:   This role is part of the Kairos Data Science team, which consists of data scientists, engineers, and product managers responsible for building a highly scalable ML-based customer personalization platform. We process petabytes of data and 20k+ customer features to train machine learning models and optimization algorithms that help us predict, as accurately and as early as possible,  what the customer needs ,  what makes them unique ,  where they are in the consideration cycle,  and more .  Our ML products are leveraged across the enterprise to drive many downstream content, targeting, bidding, and other decisions across many channels and placements. We have a global scope and power decisions across all Wayfair markets (US, Canada, EU) and stores (Wayfair, AllModern, Joss & Main, Perigold, and Birchlane).  About the role:  We are looking for a technical and team leader to join Wayfair’s Kairos Data Science team, to own the Customer Personalization model suite. You’ll develop and maintain machine learning models for representing the customer’s style and price preferences, buying habits, brand-affinity, and more. Your scope will include both building new models as well as supporting existing models that are already in production. You will also manage a team of 2-3 Machine Learning Data Scientists.  What you’ll do   Drive the vision for a new area of machine learning work with an ambitious charter  Architect and develop end-to-end Machine Learning models/Reinforcement learning systems, working collaboratively with your team and cross-functional partners to build scalable solutions  Partner with marketers to understand pain points and translate them into clear and robust data science solutions  Build and own execution of a technical roadmap, ensuring that the vision aligns with broader company objectives  Help grow the team through mentorship and developing learning opportunities  Promote a culture of data science excellence and strengthen the technical expertise of our data science, engineering, and marketing teams   What you’ll need   5+ years of experience working as a professional data scientist or ML engineer, including autonomously designing and building production models and algorithmic decision-making systems at scale  2+ years of experience managing and mentoring data scientists, analysts, or engineers  Hands-on experience developing and deploying ML models, data pipelines, and running experiments to validate your models  Excellent communication skills with demonstrated experience driving teams forward and ability to influence technical decisions to line up with the company’s strategy  Nice-to-haves:  Experience with Google Cloud Platform, Airflow, and containerization (Docker)  Experience using Contextual Multi-armed Bandits, or Reinforcement Learning in an applied setting  Advanced degree (Master or PhD) in a quantitative field   About Wayfair Inc.  Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.  No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us to achieve our mission.              With over 15,000 employees worldwide, the Microsoft Customer Experience and Success (CEnS) organization is responsible for the strategy, design, and implementation of the Microsoft end-to-end customer experience. This newly expanded organization reflects the Microsoft ambition to be known as a customer experience company, ensuring our Microsoft mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more is enabled by delighting customers and consistently exceeding their expectations in every interaction through a connected customer experience.              Microsoft has a tremendous opportunity to exceed customer expectations and drive greater customer loyalty and trust, which leads to greater satisfaction, retention, and growth. The CEnS organization is looking for people with a passion for delivering customer success to help us build a future where customers come to us, not only because we provide industry-leading products and services, and also because we provide a differentiated and connected customer experience that is rooted in our commitment to delivering on customer outcomes.              We are looking for an intellectually curious, customer-obsessed Support Engineering Manager, who has a demonstrated track record in building teams through effective and strong leadership and has empowered people to help customers succeed. As a Support Engineering Manager (SEM), you will focus on building and leading a high performing team of engineers. You’ll have the opportunity to work with large scale systems with trillions of rows and many petabytes of data and incredible complexity. job_title: Senior Behavioral Scientist - Human Evaluation, Insights, & Science, Apple Media Products
job_Description: Summary  Posted: Apr 20, 2022  Weekly Hours:  40  Role Number: 200368244  The Apple Media Products Engineering team is one of the most exciting examples of Apple’s long-held passion for combining art and technology. These are the people who power the App Store, Apple TV, Apple Music, Apple Podcasts, and Apple Books. And they do it on a massive scale, meeting Apple’s high expectations with high performance to deliver a huge variety of entertainment in over 35 languages to more than 150 countries. The Apple Media Products Evaluation team is looking for a Senior Behavioral Scientist to design, coordinate, execute, and monitor research studies which enable the development and validation of machine learning models. Moreover, the person in this role will work to identify new and innovative opportunities to apply behavioral science and achieve impact. Behavioral Scientists work to answer the most challenging questions in design. In this role, you will reveal what our users need from our products by conducting both primary and secondary research, exploring the behaviors and motivations of our users, and working with teams of Data Scientists, Product Managers, Engineers, and others to develop new evaluation methodologies and user research studies. You’ll inspire change at all stages of product development by delivering exciting oral, written, and visual presentations about our findings. Most importantly, your job as a researcher is to help the Evaluation team understand what would make a user’s experiences feel more intuitive, accessible, fun—and even magical! With considerable experience, you evaluate all the features contributing to user experience and behavior, providing expertise, collaborating internally and occasionally leading projects. You contribute new processes and identify product and use requirements. You will combine broad skills in experimental design, qualitative methods, statistical analysis, programming, and behavioral science theory/methods to shape the product and research direction for products used and loved by all Apple customers. You will identify and quantify problems, and embark on new research areas worth exploring through innovative methods by applying principles of rigorous and ethical research to build and improve products that satisfy users' needs and exceed their expectations.  Key Qualifications  Experience applying behavioral science principles and methodologies in an industry, government, or nonprofit setting  Expertise in applied qualitative methods (e.g., interview, focus groups, thematic analysis).  Strong foundation in data collection, data management, statistical inference, and the application of advanced multivariate/causal modeling methods  Expertise in experimental design and methods from A/B tests to multi-method behavioral science experiments, including field experiments  Experience with survey design and analysis (specifically for the purposes of experimental and quantitative analysis)  Fluent in at least one statistical programming language (E.g., R, Python, or similar); basic competency with SQL is a plus  Comfort working within ambiguous problem spaces and working as part of a cross-functional team  Ability to formulate and advocate for R&D objectives and results to cross-functional team members including executive business leadership and product management  Knowledge of product development process for both hardware and software products, including data driven algorithm development process  Exceptional oral, written, and visual storytelling skills. Can effectively communicate to both technical and non-technical audiences  Ability to translate research findings into actionable data-driven recommendations  Preferred qualification: Coding experience and working knowledge in machine learning concepts  Preferred qualification: Established contributor and/or reviewer of research for top conferences and publications, ideally attracting invited talks and submissions to such  Description  Examine existing data, product designs, and prior research to identify research gaps. Work on unusually complex technical problems, providing solutions that are highly innovative and inventive, impacting Apple and/or industry Maintain up-to-date knowledge of academic research and attend conferences that are relevant to problems machine learning teams are working on, and determine approaches to apply that research to our work Find opportunities to improve the capabilities we deliver in terms of revenue and profitability, performance, explainability, stability, robustness, etc. Work with team leadership to set research and development roadmap to deliver benefit to Evaluation, designing and suggesting improvements across multiple domains Disseminate behavioral science concepts and frameworks via workshops, presentations, and collaboration Communicate at all levels of the company, presenting hypotheses, proposals, and experimental results, and making valuable contributions to the discussion of such contributions from colleagues in internal, Apple wide, and external professional settings Draw on behavioral science literature to advise the team in taking scientifically informed and well-considered risks in our pursuit of solutions to difficult technical problems Navigate across Apple, pulling in peers where needed and providing valuable expertise across the company  Education & Experience  PhD or Master’s degree (PhD preferred) in Psychology, Behavioral Science/Economics, Cognitive Science, Statistics, Social Science, Human-Computer Interaction or related field.  Additional Requirements

Overview:        Research Computing advances scientific discovery by providing researchers computational tools to accelerate their research outcomes. We support computationally enabled science by providing researchers access to computational building blocks (e.g., HPC, Machine Learning environments, Data Management Tools etc.). We also provide services, expertise, and support to researchers to optimize their use of our capabilities (e.g., HPC Consulting, Cloud Deployment Support, etc.), all while fostering a culture of computing through interdisciplinary collaboration and access to computational resources.          We are seeking an entry level data engineer to join project teams building solutions in a variety of domains. These will primarily be around research data movement.              Your scope of work will be diverse and will include joining existing project teams across the Lab. The work will include designing, coding, testing, debugging, and implementing data pipelines in support of projects and workflows. You must understand and have experience in a mix of technologies such as SQL, Python, R, Ansible, or Tableau. In addition, it will be highly beneficial if you have experience in integrating data pipelines with existing data repositories.Initially you will join existing project teams, and as such you will be expected to operate within specific guidelines and coding standards. As your career develops you will be increasingly responsible for building your own opportunities within PNNL and developing opportunities for other staff to follow.    Responsibilities:        Designs, develops, documents, tests, and debugs data systems, interfaces, and/or applications according to industry-established data engineering principles and best practices. Works collaboratively within a team to execute the full data development lifecycle including analyzing user needs to determine technical requirements; developing technical specifications based on conceptual design and requirements; developing well‐crafted and documented source code; automating manual tasks; and consulting with the end user to prototype, configure, refine, test, and debug data systems to meet needs. Identifies and evaluates new technologies or methods for implementation and continuous improvement.              #LI-Remote    Qualifications:        Minimum Qualifications:           BS/BA with 0-1 years of experience      MS/MA with 0 years of experience      Relevant Associate’s degree and 4 years of relevant work experience      High school diploma and 8 years of relevant work experience               Preferred Qualifications:           Experience participating in defining objectives by analyzing user requirements      Experience working with project teams, developing new data systems, and supporting existing systems.      Integrating raw data with backend databases      Experience with participating in teams deploying Agile Methodologies     Hazardous Working Conditions/Environment:        N/A    Additional Information:        Not Applicable    Testing Designated Position (TDP):        Not Applicable    About PNNL:        Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is a world-class research institution powered by a highly educated, diverse workforce committed to the values of Integrity, Creativity, Collaboration, Impact, and Courage. Every year, scores of dynamic, driven people come to PNNL to work with renowned researchers on meaningful science, innovations and outcomes for the U.S. Department of Energy and other sponsors; here is your chance to be one of them!           At PNNL, you will find an exciting research environment and excellent benefits including health insurance, flexible work schedules and telework options. PNNL is located in eastern Washington State—the dry side of Washington known for its stellar outdoor recreation and affordable cost of living. The Lab’s campus is only a 45-minute flight (or ~3 hour drive) from Seattle or Portland, and is serviced by the convenient PSC airport, connected to 8 major hubs.    Commitment to Excellence, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Equal Employment Opportunity:        Our laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment dedicated to solving critical challenges in fundamental sciences, national security, and energy resiliency. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. In support of this commitment, we encourage people of all racial/ethnic identities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment.              Pacific Northwest National Laboratory considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status, and any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local laws.                    We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures and in employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at hr@pnnl.gov.    Drug Free Workplace:        PNNL is committed to a drug-free workplace supported by Workplace Substance Abuse Program (WSAP) and complies with federal laws prohibiting the possession and use of illegal drugs.

job_title: Scientist / Senior Scientist / Principal Scientist, Machine Learning
job_Description: Location: Seattle preferred but open to remote  A-Alpha Bio Summary  A-Alpha Bio is an early stage and rapidly growing drug discovery company headquartered in Seattle, WA. We are enabling the next generation of high-impact therapeutics with synthetic biology and machine learning. We partner with leading pharma and biotech companies to enable the discovery of antibodies, molecular glues, and other protein interaction-related drugs.  Role Description  We are seeking an exceptional Machine Learning Scientist, Senior Machine Learning Scientist, or Principal Machine Learning Scientist to work at the cutting edge of machine learning for drug discovery and optimization, utilizing data from our proprietary high-throughput AlphaSeq platform to deliver high-impact therapeutics.  Responsibilities   Develop and apply robust machine learning methods to predict, characterize and engineer protein-protein interactions  Establish processes for large-scale data curation and model development, validation, and benchmarking.  Communicate with internal and external collaborators to design experiments and manage critical metadata  Engage with global research, industry, and standards development communities to keep abreast of new technologies and best practices.  Depending on level, lead a team of machine learning scientists   Requirements   Graduate degree (PhD preferred) in Computer Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, Genomics, or related field  2+ years of hands-on experience with machine learning using biological sequence or structure data  Impressive track record of publications/accomplishments in machine learning at top-tier academic institutions or companies  Must be highly self-motivated, intellectually curious, and excited to thrive in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary, and team-oriented start-up environment   Preferred Qualifications   Fluency with modern cloud computing environments  Experience with large scale database and data warehousing systems (Redshift, Oracle, etc.)  Familiar with the state of the art in antibody engineering, protein engineering, synthetic biology, or other high-throughput biology environments  Expertise with Python data science tools (Keras, NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib etc.) and deep learning frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.).   We offer competitive compensation including a pay package, benefits, and equity in a fast-growing start-up. Job title will be set based on experience and track record, so we encourage applicants with a wide range of backgrounds to apply.  About A-Alpha Bio  A-Alpha Bio is an early-stage biotechnology company combining synthetic biology and machine learning to dramatically improve the discovery of high-impact therapeutics. We believe that abundant high-quality data is critical for understanding biology and curing disease – and synthetic biology is our catalyst. Our proprietary AlphaSeq platform uses genetically engineered cells to quantitatively measure millions of protein interactions – from which we generate high-resolution models of biology.  In 2018, we spun out of the University of Washington's Institute for Protein Design and Center for Synthetic Biology – both fantastic communities of brilliant and highly entrepreneurial scientist. Initial financial support came from the National Science Foundation, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and a seed round in September 2019 led by OS Fund. Since the company's inception, we have focused on partnering with pharmaceutical companies to discover and optimize drugs for therapeutic areas ranging from infectious disease to cancer. We are growing rapidly, and new members of the team should expect a fast-paced and highly dynamic work environment. We are building a diverse, meritocratic, and supportive team that values hard work, creativity, transparency, individual and team growth, flexibility, and kindness.  A-Alpha Bio is headquartered in Seattle at Fluke Hall, a startup incubator operated by the University of Washington (although, we will be moving soon!). While the startup lifestyle occasionally requires grueling hours, we strongly value the need for a work-life balance and time out of the lab/office. We are fortunate to be situated in a region that is renowned for its premier outdoor activities, including hiking, biking, climbing, skiing, kayaking, and sailing. At A-Alpha, you'll find many who love the outdoors, but also gamers, bakers, photographers, brewers, jetsetters, animal lovers, and artists. Whatever your passions, you belong at A-Alpha Bio.

job_title: AI/ML - Machine Learning Research Engineer, Siri Understanding
job_Description: Summary  Posted: Mar 19, 2022  Role Number: 200358547  “Hey Siri, let’s work together at Apple!“ The Siri Understanding team is looking for Machine Learning Engineers passionate about enabling personalized Siri interactions and delivering such technology to users on a global scale. Build end-to-end model training and evaluation pipelines. Push the envelope on the latest research developments in speech invocation and speaker recognition. Deploy machine-learned, on-device models that are aligned with the core values of Apple, ensuring the highest standards of quality, innovation, and respect for user privacy. And work with the people who created the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people around the world get things done — just by saying ‘Hey Siri.’  Key Qualifications  Strong background in machine learning and deep learning; experience in speech, speaker, and/or language recognition a plus  Solid foundation in machine learning fundamentals, such as classification, feature engineering, clustering, semi-supervised learning, and domain adaptation  Proficiency in deep learning / machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow) and scripting languages (e.g., Python, bash), with strong software engineering fundamentals and an interest in optimizing and scaling systems globally  Strong attention to detail, along with the analytical skills and the willingness to dive into data to explain anomalies and conduct error/deviation analyses  Outstanding problem solving, critical thinking, creativity, and interpersonal skills; ability to communicate effectively with engineers, scientists, managers, and cross-functional partners  Description  You will be part of a team whose focus is on applied machine learning, on building and deploying models that constantly advance the state-of-the-art. But that is only half the story! In Siri Understanding, we own our products and user experiences end-to-end. We measure the impact of our deployed models not just on offline test sets, but also on production traffic. We optimize error rates on existing data. We also define new metrics and apply them to the data that best represents the next feature we ship. And we are sometimes constrained by the limits of on-device computation — that is where your ability to innovate will be most impactful. You will collaborate with many dynamic, cross-functional teams consisting of software engineers and machine learning engineers/scientists. The ideal candidate will excel in both academic rigor and engineering efficacy, staying up-to-date with the latest research advancements as well as delivering reliable and robust models to all devices for all users around the world. If you are passionate about building outstanding products and using the full spectrum of your skills to extend the core technology that lets Siri understand, personalize, and interact in new and exciting ways, then we cannot wait to hear from you.  Education & Experience  Ph. D. in a Machine Learning or related field, or M.S. with 3+ experience in Machine Learning  Additional Requirements

job_title: Software Engineer lll, Machine Learning Infrastructure, Project Starline
job_Description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following:    Mountain View, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA .    Minimum qualifications:          Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.      2 years of experience with software development in C++ and Python, or 1 year of experience with an advanced degree.      2 years of experience with data structures or algorithms in either an academic or industry setting.        Preferred qualifications:          Master's degree or PhD in Computer Science or related technical field.      2 years of experience with machine learning algorithms and tools (e.g., TensorFlow), artificial intelligence, deep learning, and/or natural language processing.      Experience developing accessible technologies.      Experience building pipelines for collecting, labelling, and cleaning training data for Machine Learning models.      Experience building infrastructure for evaluating Machine Learning models.      Experience writing Flume pipelines and deploying TensorFlow models, computer vision, and/or video processing.            About the job      Google's software engineers develop the next-generation technologies that change how billions of users connect, explore, and interact with information and one another. Our products need to handle information at massive scale, and extend well beyond web search. We're looking for engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, artificial intelligence, natural language processing, UI design and mobile; the list goes on and is growing every day. As a software engineer, you will work on a specific project critical to Google’s needs with opportunities to switch teams and projects as you and our fast-paced business grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.    With your technical expertise you will manage project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables. You will design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and enhance software solutions.       We are a subteam building cutting-edge algorithms and infrastructure to improve the quality of video calls in Google Meet and Duo using Machine Learning and Computer Vision. This requires researching and developing novel ML models and optimizing and deploying them for real time video processing.  You’ll work with researchers and engineers in a fast-paced product-oriented environment, and work closely with the Meet team and collaborate with Google Research.Project Starline from Google combines advances in hardware and software to enable friends, families and co-workers to feel together, even when they’re cities (or countries) apart. Imagine looking through a magic window, and through that window, you see another person, life-size and in three-dimensions.          As part of the Project Starline team, you'll work with researchers and engineers in a fast-paced product-oriented environment. Our teams collaborate closely with Google Workspace and Research teams. Your contributions will have an impact on the future of communications with Google products. You will apply technology to solve that really important problem that we often want to be together and we can’t.           Responsibilities           Develop breakthrough features for Meet/Duo using computer vision and machine learning.       Design, run, and maintain internal pipelines and tools for data collection and evaluation of ML models for video processing.       Optimize and deploy TensorFlow models in production.       Collaborate cross-functionally with Meet/Duo and Research teams.         Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Who is Recruiting from Scratch:      Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.                       About Our Client                         Our client is the first sleep fitness company. They design products at the forefront of sleep innovation. Our client's mission is to make people’s sleep count for more, using innovative technology, detailed design, and proven science and data to personalize and improve each night for everybody—changing the way people sleep forever and for the better.                Our client wants to fuel human potential through optimal sleep. In 2019, they launched our temperature-regulated smart bed, The Pod. They currently power the sleep of over 60,000 people every night. They have partnered with Barry’s as their Official Sleep Fitness Partner. Our client actively collaborates with Justin Medeiros, 2021 Crossfit Champion and Red Gerard, U.S. Snowboarding Olympic Gold-Medalist. GQ awarded our client the Fitness Reward in 2021, along with receiving the Men’s Health Sleep Award that same year. Our client is backed by leading Silicon Valley investors and recognized as one of the Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies In Consumer Electronics.                Our client is looking for an experienced Data Scientist to help them expand their product features and their capabilities to bring the highest quality sleep to as many people as possible. As a Data Scientist, you will have a big impact on the direction of their products and engineering efforts. Your job will be to solve complex problems by making sense of massive amounts of sleep data and distilling it down into actionable directions and insights. You will be empowered to drive the full lifecycle of a project from data collection, exploration, visualization, modeling, experimentation, and deployment. We are seeking someone with a passion to work with one of the largest datasets of sleep in the world, and to be a part of growing and shaping the future of sleep.                    About The Role                              Develop data-driven insights to identify opportunities and recommend prioritization of product, engineering, and optimization initiatives.                           Support our client's engineering and ML efforts by building the tools and models to measure and define their goals.                           Independently run data experiments and build proof of concepts to better use data and improve our client's products.                           Prepare and manage large datasets to run experiments with the goal of optimizing the sleep of their users.                                  What You'll Need to Succeed                              M.S. or Bachelors degree in Math, Statistics, Engineering, or Computer Science                           5+ years experience in developing, testing, and deploying optimized predictive models                           Languages: SQL, Python                           Tools/Software: Pandas, Scikit Learn, Jupyter Notebooks, AWS                           ML Techniques: Clustering, Decision Trees, Neural Networks                           Statistics: Regression, Statistical Testing                           Ability to communicate data and technical work to non-technical stakeholders                                  Why You’ll Love Our Client                              A tight-knit, passionate team that’s working to improve people’s lives by improving the way they sleep                           Leadership is committed to employees’ wellness and career development                           You’ll get a better night's sleep every night                           Flexible, generous PTO                           100% employer contribution for medical/dental/vision insurance                                        Base Salary Range:  150K-190K

1+ years of experience contributing to the system design or architecture (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems.     2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience     Programming experience with at least one software programming language.     Job summary   Lead projects on a team reinventing product navigation and discovery on Amazon. As a Software Engineer on Shopping Navigator in Personalization, you will join a brand new initiative bringing an exciting new product to life. This is a greenfield opportunity to join a small budding 7-person team and improve the way millions of customers navigate on Amazon.        About you:    You love the idea of inventing cool new products from the ground up. You are an experienced builder with strong technical judgment, clear communication skills, and get stuff done wickedly fast. You are technically fearless and not afraid to roll up your sleeves working across the stack. You might have experience building highly scalable distributed systems, and/or implementing state-of-the-art machine learning models and infrastructure. You might know how to build beautiful front-end features. You are excited about the chance to work on large-scale distributed systems and models that will power new navigation features with learned ontologies. You are excited to work at the intersection of engineering and machine learning, with a team of two scientists and four engineers. You are interested in diving deep into natural language processing, deep learning, and possibly graph learning among others. You are an effective teacher and mentor to other engineers, and want to pursue projects worthy of the next level.        About us together:    Together we are going to build the future of shopping navigation at earth’s largest e-commerce company. We will invent scalable new approaches to accurately describe and organize Amazon’s massive breadth of products. We will build new user experiences to make navigating Amazon's selection more intuitive, seamless and easy. We will build machine learning systems that anticipate what customers are looking for, and understanding what they are telling us from their online behavior. We will empower customers to hone in on the exactly what they seek.      Key job responsibilities        As a part of this role, you will:          Help build new navigation experiences from the ground up, from design through implementation, launch and oversight.     Build end-to-end features, from large-scale data and modeling pipelines, real-time recommender systems, data-mining and processing, to launching new frontend navigation features.     Contribute to the long-term software development strategy for the team, both in designing and building critical components, and mentoring other engineers.     Work alongside a very technically strong Sr. Engineer on our team, to grow to the next level.     Partner with applied scientists to scale and productionize cutting edge machine learning models.     Mentor other engineers, improving their skills and ability to get things done.     MS or industry equivalent experience in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Math or related field     Industry experience related to machine learning systems, bid data pipelines, and/or recommender systems     Experience with distributed computing and highly scalable systems, including tools such as EMR/Hadoop/Spark     Highly motivated self-starter with bias for innovative thinking     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Summary     Creating a unique and relevant experience for each and every user is fundamental to Disney magic. We aim to tailor our products for every user, quickly connecting them to content they’ll love. This process is both art and science, relying on authoritative content expertise, algorithmic machine learning, and rapid experimentation. The work we do has huge scope- the services in Disney Streaming enable experiences for 175+ million users across Disney+, Hulu, Star+ and ESPN+. And we’re not done growing.     We are looking for a senior product manager who will lead our experimentation portfolio across our Personalization, Merchandising, Search and Interactive teams.     This is a position that will have an incredibly broad impact on the customer experience across multiple applications.     This is an ideal role for someone with a history running complex experimentation programs, values cross-functional collaboration and partnership and has a passion for machine learning. You should be able to balance pragmatism and vision to achieve meaningful results amongst a rapidly growing and changing user base.     WHAT YOU'LL DO         Lead the Consumer Engagement & Interactive team’s experimentation program with a focus on evolving our current experimentation framework to increase test volume and velocity.      Partner closely with our Content Programming, Machine Learning, Data Analytics and Experimentation Platform teams to coordinate experiment backlogs, new feature integration, experiment execution and evaluation.      Serve as a thought leader in the experimentation space, advocating for best practices and disseminating learning across the organization.      Work with experimentation and content tooling teams to advocate for enhancements to our experimentation platforms.      Lead cross-team experimentation brainstorm sessions.      Partner with fellow product managers to ideate releases, pipeline and go/no go decisions for rollout of features.      Maintain open communication channels for internal and external partners to clarify usage, document experiment status, and find opportunities to improve the experimentation process      Deliver business-driving improvements to our search, personalization and interactive feature sets. We are a team that can (and does) nerd out about algorithms, but who also lands huge business impact in the form of increased subscriber watch hours and churn reduction.      Assess new experiments with the critical lens of an investor. We have limited bandwidth and plenty of opportunities to improve. What do we do first?        WHAT YOU'LL BRING         BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent work experience      4+ years of experience as a program or product manager or highly relevant direct experience (i.e. working as a data scientist or engineering in the personalization space)      Experience in working on complex services      Data-focused mindset and proven ability to use data to explore all aspects of a problem      Familiarity with machine learning fundamentals      Clear, logical communication skills and an ability to adjust your style based upon your audience - from non-technical to research PhDs.      Passion for TV      Curiosity - in this space, we often find ourselves reading the latest research paper or playing with a new proof-of-concept.

7+ years of experience working directly within engineering teams     Experience partnering with product OR program management teams     3+ years of people management experience, managing engineers     3+ years of experience architecting and designing (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems     Job summary   Join the team building OpenSearch, the newly-launched open-source forks of Elasticsearch and Kibana. As a community-driven project, multiple companies and individuals will share responsibility for contributing, guiding, and ensuring open source versions of both products remain available and well supported for the long term.AWS, as one of those contributors, is looking to hire a variety of full-time roles dedicated to developing, enhancing, and supporting OpenSearch. Much of the work is software engineering, and there is also a need for front-end development, technical writing, user experience design, community engagement, and many other roles. This is a unique opportunity to develop open-source software in a customer obsessed, highly collaborative team-oriented environment, while leveraging the resources of Amazon.com (AMZN), one of the world's leading internet companies.      Key job responsibilities   Are you passionate about Open Source or Elasticsearch? Contact xiaoyu@ for more info. : )      Have you ever wanted to build open source software that can scale to support the largest companies in the world?      AWS recently announced it will be leading an open-source forks of Elasticsearch and Kibana in order to ensure that open source versions will remain available and well supported. As part of that effort, we'll be building out a new team to develop visualization tools for Elasticsearch.      So come work with us – you can build innovative solutions with some of the best engineers on the planet while contributing back to the community.      Who are you? You’re a manager who's passionate about open source and building your team. You've spent years leaning how to build relationships not just with your reports, but with your peers and your leadership. You deliver feedback with conviction and praise with sincerity. You work hard every day to bring out the best in your engineers, to hold a high technical bar for your product, and to make sure we always ship software we're proud of. You love working with designers and engineers to bring software experiences to life that are functional *and* dazzling.      Who are we? We are a new team at AWS creating open source products for OpenSearch (previously Elasticsearch). We want to build the best software in the world and give it away. Our mission is to build products that help users understand their data by leveraging Machine Learning technologies, and to do it in ways that inspire other developers in the community to contribute.      About the team   Inclusive Team Culture   Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.      Work/Life Balance   Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.      Mentorship & Career Growth   Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.            Master’s in Computer Science or related field     Experience as a contributor to Open Source Software. or managing a team working in Open Source Software     Experience working with Elasticsearch/Kibana or other Logs Analytics and Observability tools.     An inspirational technical leader with a high emotional intelligence who sets high and exacting standards and demands the best work of their team     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

3+ years of experience as a UX Writer or a related role     Bachelor's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), English, Journalism, Marketing/Communications, a related field, or 4+ years of additional experience     An available online portfolio           Job summary    Note on Location: We are open to this role being located in any Amazon corporate office location in the United States or Canada.        We are looking for an enthusiastic UX writer to craft the voice, tone and personality of the content in our ecosystem of products and help create clear, helpful, human guidelines.         "We see our customers as invited guests to a party, and we are the hosts. It's our job every day to make every important aspect of the customer experience a little bit better." - Jeff Bezos, Founder & CEO.        Amazon’s Customer Service design team powers the tools that our customers and associates around the world use to solve problems, ensuring that we remain the most customer-obsessed company in the world.        You’ll collaborate with across our design studio and beyond, working with designers, researchers, engineers, machine learning scientists, and product managers, working on projects throughout the planning, design and development lifecycle. You’ll also get to advocate for language and writing excellence through hands-on writing and meeting with partners.        As a UX writer on the team, you’ll get to:            Translate complicated concepts into jargon-free, concise UI copy      Help ensure that both customers and Amazon customer service associates have the right information at the right moment      Dive into the needs of customers and associates based on data and UX research, and turn that into guidelines and patterns        If you love simplifying complexity and always find yourself asking—“Could this be clearer? Could this be more conversational?"—then let’s talk.        Key job responsibilities           Collaborate with UX designers, product teams, and researchers to craft and hone language across a variety of contexts from UI components to conversational text     Raise the bar for interface/product communication and drive alignment on voice and tone     Anticipate user needs based on their objectives and explore innovative solutions to users issues     Write for and iterate on user-centered solutions by considering market segment analysis, user feedback, site metrics, accessibility, and usability findings        A day in the life    Each day of the week will likely be different, but you'll be working weekly with UX research, UX Design, and product teams to establish interface writing guidelines and patterns, validated by UX studies, product metrics or other data.        You'll also regularly be participating in meetings with product/UX/tech stakeholders to discuss the products content strategy when needed.        Finally, you'll be providing guidance to your UX teammates on their respective product UX during work sessions, program reviews, and office hours.        About the team    The Word & Voice Design team owns numerous Amazon customer-facing and associate-facing products content, from the conversational AI bots that assist customers with their orders, to the interfaces our Amazon associates use to solve customers issues.        We are a small team of UX writers, conversational and voice designers, and we're part of the bigger Customer Service UX Studio, which owns the Amazon customers and associates experience with Customer Service.        We love staying close to our users, understand their needs and pain points through data, and research to make sure we create the best solutions for them. Also, we like escape rooms, crafts, pet stories, and GIFs.               An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating experience creating and writing for user-centered design solutions, including problems you helped solve for, your contributions, and impact to the customer      Experience independently driving the UX writing review cycle and meeting customer and business requirements      Ability to manage multiple projects at once      Experience with UX writing for complex workflows, software products      Experience working with user research and analyzing customer feedback      Demonstrated history of reviewing customer data and leveraging it to developing precise UX content      Experience working directly with designers, product managers, researchers, and other subject matter experts      Experience working cross-team and synthesizing feedback and input from multiple stakeholders      Working knowledge of the design process        Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

job_title: Sr. Software Engineer (Refer to Job # LL21)
job_Description: Who is Wyze?                   Wyze is a high growth, Series B, consumer technology company. Our vision is to make great technology accessible to everyone through our smart home platform. Our aim is to serve everyday people, like me, you, and our friends and families, with too good to be true products and services. We want employees who will be inspired by this and welcome all who will help us build the next amazing chapter at Wyze.                      Wyze is home to some of the most innovative products and services in the market. Time Magazine selected us for their 100 Most Influential Companies of 2022, Fast Company named us as one of the Most Innovative Companies in 2021 and PCMag gave our Cam v3 an Editor’s Choice Award. We disrupted the market with our Wyze Cam v1 and then quickly took over as a market leader in the space. We recently disrupted it again with our revolutionary Cam Plus Pro service. GeekWire calls us a start-up to watch and one of the Pacific Northwest’s next unicorns… and we are just getting started.                      Our people centric innovative vision is not only present in our products and services, but it is also embedded in the fabric of our company. We were just listed in the Top 100 Best Places to Work by Built in Seattle, listed as one of their Best Midsize Companies to Work For and awarded as one of their Companies with the Best Benefits. Seattle Business Magazine certified us as a Best Places to Work too!                      We value the unique life experiences every employee brings to work every day. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment whereby our employees are encouraged to be their authentic whole selves and are rewarded for their impact across the company. Everyone is welcome and empowered to do the best work of their lives.                      Our stance on workplace flexibility:             For most roles, we support a 100% remote work environment for applicants who reside in the following states: California, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Texas, Utah, Virginia, and Washington.                      Come join us and make the impossible, possible!                  Design and build AI platform for data, model, and service. Develop software solutions by studying information needs by conferring with users, studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating             problem areas by following the software development life-cycle; identifying and resolving the ambiguities between business logic and implementation level. Full Time.                    Requirements:             Master degree in Computer Science, or a closely related field.;  3-yr exp. in designing and developing large-scale, multi-threaded, distributed software applications;  Exp. in backend development with modern cloud environments, in- depth knowledge in Machine Learning or Machine Learning Infrastructure.                         To apply: Send resume to HR, Wyze Labs, Inc,             5808 Lake Washington Blvd Ste 300, Kirkland, WA 98033.             Must refer to Job # LL21.                  Our Benefits                   Wyze has a full benefits package through Premera Blue Cross. This includes Medical, Dental, Vision, Basic Life Insurance, Voluntary Life Insurance, EAP, Short-term disability, Long-term disability, FSA, and Daycare FSA. Employee premiums will be paid 100%, and 80% paid premium for dependents.                      12 Holidays - 8 set holidays and 4 Floating Holidays for you to use however you choose             24 days of PTO every year             Additional Wyze anniversary vacation days             Principal 401k Plan - there is no company match at this time             Wyze employee product perks: Wyze employees receive Wyze products as the products are released (new employees will have access to Wyze products)             Employees will also receive Wyze software services once they are launched             Rosetta Stone reimbursement if you'd like to learn Mandarin             $50 a month reimbursed as a technology stipend - taxes apply                       Come Join Us! We will ensure individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Materials Scientist 2 in Polymer Aging           Richland, Washington       Sustainable Energy and Engineering       Regular Full-Time       No       05/09/2022       3811                   Job Description           Overview             The Applied Materials & Manufacturing (AMM) Group at Pacific Northwest National Laboratory is seeking a new team member at either the Materials Scientist 2 or Materials Scientist 3 (see related posting) level to help execute and expand business in the predictive understanding of polymer materials aging, including methods to detect and quantify changes in polymer structure and performance with exposure to environmental stress such as heat, radiation, and moisture.                      Research within the AMM group is aimed at both reducing the impact of materials and their manufacture on the environment, along with material performance assessment for a variety of in-service conditions. This position will support business lines associated with nuclear and renewable energy, electrical cable insulation, medical product sterilization, bio-based materials, lightweight vehicle components, and other markets with the goal of improving service lifetime predictions of polymer material-based systems.                      Responsibilities             The successful candidate will have an established local reputation and developing external reputation, also specializing in at least one technical domain related to polymer material aging, testing, characterization or failure analysis. Expectations for the incumbent include building effective project teams internally, serving as principal investigator or co-PI on projects/tasks while integrating capabilities of work team members. The candidate will support scoping, scheduling, and budgeting at a project or major task level, generate new ideas for proposals and business development opportunities, and lead the development of technical sections of small to medium proposals. Additional key indicators for success in this position will include mentoring junior staff and embracing expectations for quality, safety, and security.                      Qualifications             Minimum Qualifications:                 BS/BA with 2 years of experience        MS/MA with 0-2 years of experience        PhD with 0 years of experience                 Preferred Qualifications:                 Demonstrated record of publication in top-tier journals and an ability to collaborate and lead within a teaming environment.                 Subject matter expertise in the following areas is highly preferred:                 Strong mechanical aptitude and ability to work hands-on in a laboratory environment designing and setting up new experiments        Knowledge of polymer material science: plastics, elastomers, structure/performance relationships        Background performing characterization of polymers such as mechanical, physical, optical, chemical characterization        Polymer and composite material degradation & understanding of failure modes and analysis with specific emphasis on degradation under elevated temperature, aqueous or ionizing radiation environments        Experience adhering to or developing mechanical and material testing methodologies (ASTM, etc.)        Material remaining useful lifetime prediction                 In addition, the following will be helpful for success:                 Drive for self-improvement, new job skill development and continuous learning        Ability to coordinate, plan and execute the work of self and others to keep project activities within scope and on schedule        Excellent oral and written communications skills, including ability to clearly communicate goals, key details, and outcomes of research        Ability to work in teams with a diverse set of research staff, deliver on project tasks, and accommodate rapid and sometimes demanding schedules        Familiarity and understanding of analytical instrumentation such as FTIR, UV-VIS, DSC, TGA-MS, DMA, universal testing machine (e.g., Instron), durometer, light booth, and/or nanoindentation is a plus.                  Hazardous Working Conditions/Environment             The staff member will work in research laboratories, which are inherently hazardous working environments. Exposure to mechanical hazards, chemicals, etc., are kept to a minimum and mitigated through the use of controls and the maintenance of a safety-conscious work environment.                      Additional Information             Travel is anticipated for this position, up to 5 times per year to attend business conferences and collaboration meetings.                      Testing Designated Position             Not Applicable                      About PNNL             Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) is a world-class research institution powered by a highly educated, diverse workforce committed to the values of Integrity, Creativity, Collaboration, Impact, and Courage. Every year, scores of dynamic, driven people come to PNNL to work with renowned researchers on meaningful science, innovations and outcomes for the U.S. Department of Energy and other sponsors; here is your chance to be one of them!                 At PNNL, you will find an exciting research environment and excellent benefits including health insurance, flexible work schedules and telework options. PNNL is located in eastern Washington State—the dry side of Washington known for its stellar outdoor recreation and affordable cost of living. The Lab’s campus is only a 45-minute flight (or ~3 hour drive) from Seattle or Portland, and is serviced by the convenient PSC airport, connected to 8 major hubs.                      Commitment to Excellence, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Equal Employment Opportunity             Our laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment dedicated to solving critical challenges in fundamental sciences, national security, and energy resiliency. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. In support of this commitment, we encourage people of all racial/ethnic identities, women, veterans, and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment.                      Pacific Northwest National Laboratory considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, and gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information (including family medical history), protected veteran status, and any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state, and/or local laws.                                We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures and in employment. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, contact us at hr@pnnl.gov.                      Drug Free Workplace             PNNL is committed to a drug-free workplace supported by Workplace Substance Abuse Program (WSAP) and complies with federal laws prohibiting the possession and use of illegal drugs.                      Mandatory Requirements             Battelle requires employees to have a COVID-19 vaccine as a condition of employment, subject to accommodation. Applicants are required to disclose their vaccination status following a conditional offer of employment and must attest to being fully vaccinated with a Center for Disease Control (CDC)-approved COVID-19 vaccination, or provide documentation of need for medical or religious exemption from the COVID-19 vaccination requirement.

job_title: Senior Data Analyst (North America Guest Insights) *Seattle
job_Description: who we are lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people. about this team + role The North American Guest insights team focuses on providing guest insights and impactful analyses across the organization to inform short term tactics and long term strategies. This role will facilitate driving personalized guest experiences that drives higher engagements between guests and our brand.  a day in the life:  what you’ll do   This Senior Analyst is responsible for delivering analytics and data science capabilities across guest (customer) analytics and throughout the broader organization. We aim to provide impactful insights around our guests that establish and deliver the strategy and roadmap for sustained growth of analytics and data science capabilities at lululemon.  Lead analysis and reporting projects from start to finish, identifying opportunities, defining the problem, building a proof of concept, and deploying a data product.  Collaborate with business partners to understand the go-to market process, guest lifecycle, and guest strategy, and how data science products can enable excellence.  Enrich guest data through analysis, prediction, and modeling.  Collaborate with data engineering teams to improve data quality and availability.  Visualize and communicate results to senior and executive leadership across the organization.  Partner with marketing business leaders to provide information that allows for more efficient marketing. We are now looking for a Principal Technical Program Manager for Security.        NVIDIA is searching for an outstanding leader to drive and deliver key initiatives and projects for Product Software Security. The candidate is expected to take a strong, technical approach to drive secure development and engineering practices across multiple internal teams with support from the core security organization. Persons in this role will help reduce risk, threats, and vulnerabilities in NVIDIA’s machine learning, graphics, compute, and associated online and container deployed services.        What You’ll Be Doing:         Promote change and strengthen practices as subject matter authority on security within the software development life-cycle.      Work on sophisticated and mission-critical projects, using technical/interpersonal and organizational skills to plan, execute and drive all project results to success with quality and on time.      Recognize/Interpret risk, drive a mitigation plans, and strategically align project team with customer objectives.      Foster cross-functional partnerships to achieve repeat business/project success.      Provide keen insight in the development of NVIDIA security roadmaps and processes permitting comprehensive project planning, with key dependencies, checkpoints results identified at project initiation throughout project cycle.      Drive sophisticated projects soliciting inputs from senior peers/management to steer projects past obstacles/hurdles.      Project manage highly sophisticated customer or NPI projects from concept to post mortem. Projects involve new software and/or hardware technologies such as new platforms/chipset/Chip Architecture      Drive successful projects that are typically very strategic in nature to the NVIDIA business or technology positioning and leadership      Drive process improvement initiatives that are broad in scope and impact, requiring the contributions from internal and external teams      Empower and align teams to shared objectives providing transparency through innovative communication techniques into project plans, status, and issues while quickly responding to changing requirement, schedules and priorities           What We Need To See:         Bachelors in Computer Science or a relevant technical degree or equivalent experience      15+ years of professional experience in technical program management and/or engineering realms      Shown efficiency in working with teams of engineers across hardware and software in a highly multifaceted and rapidly evolving environment      Recognized ability to connect with and drive across multiple geographies and distributed teams from a remote site while maintaining effectiveness      Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills and the ability to tailor your message to different levels of management and audiences      Ability to follow-up and see things through      Solid understanding of SDLC and the security elements related therein      Experience in an Engineering or Technical role, delivering privacy and compliance      Accomplished matrix management and technical leadership experience with broad detailed understanding of engineering development methodology, customer development cycles, industry standard methodologies and interrelationship between various engineering/marketing/sales/account management functions.      Adept at creatively solving problems, leading a change in direction and inspiring cross-functional teams to address most meaningful issues.      Able to adjudicate tradeoffs and facilitate discussion to quickly make strategic key decisions in solving technical program challenges, schedule crunches or difficult operational challenges gating project success      Setting policy and implementing process improvement across the organization           Ways to stand out from the crowd:         Represent NVIDIA in the best light at conferences, building a network across companies to ensure we are aligned with security standard methodologies across the industry      Ability to work effectively in a heavily matrixed software organization to enable or drive complex initiatives      Familiarity with computer security concepts and topics, and/or familiarity with security incident response      Possess a keen-eye for process improvement and continuous learning      Initiative, persistence and determination in getting things done           With highly competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package, NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world's most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people on the planet working for us and, due to unprecedented growth, our special engineering teams are growing fast. If you're a creative and autonomous engineer with a genuine passion for technology, we want to hear from you.     The Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act requires that NVIDIA provide the compensation range and benefits offered for this position if performed in Colorado. The base salary range for this position in Colorado is $201,600.00 - 277,200.00 USD.    NVIDIA also offers a comprehensive benefits package. We provide health care coverage, dental and vision, 401(K), including company matching and after tax contributions, Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP), Employee Assistance Program (EAP), company paid holidays, paid sick leave, vacation leave, professional time off, life and disability protection. Employees in eligible sales and positions may also be eligible for commission.        Base pay is based on market location and may vary based on factors including experience, skills, education, and other job-related reasons.     NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Research Engineer, TikTok Creation and Consumption
job_Description: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. TikTok's product engineering team is responsible for building backend support for various kinds of new experiences for the TikTok app: content creation, consumption, open platform, and foundation. This includes ensuring our systems are scaling to handle the ever-growing user base of TikTok and expanding our reach by making our tools accessible through our open platform. We are looking for passionate Research Engineers, who have experience with state-of-art AI/ML infra, to assist with building strategies among our creator community, content types, content mobility, consumption experience. You will have the opportunity to work closely with Mobile Engineers, Frontend Engineers as well as SRE and Test Engineers in a high-impact and fast-paced environment. You will also have significant ownership and impact over major user-facing features and media quality that affect the core TikTok experience.  As a Research Engineer, you will be responsible for:   Leveraging the full advantage of modern machine learning techniques to build core systems and ML models to solve various creation and consumption-related problems;  Conducting cutting-edge research in user understanding, causal inference, or deep learning-related problems, and applying the technology to various business scenarios.  Ph.D. and publications in machine learning, AI, computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data science, or related technical fields;  Experience leading efforts in solving modeling problems using AI/ML approaches;  Experience in theoretical and empirical research and for addressing research problems;  Experience communicating research for public audiences of peers;  Knowledge in a programming language.   Preferred Qualifications:   Experience in creator understanding, content growth strategy, creator monetization-related research.  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at usrc@tiktok.com

Proficient in python and C/C++, and have solid programming skills. 4. Familiar with at least one of the mainstream deep learning frameworks, like TensorFlow or PyTorch. 5. Able to solve problems independently, good teamwork and communication skills. job_Description: Founded in 2012, ByteDance is a technology company operating a range of content platforms that inform, educate, entertain and inspire people across languages, cultures and geographies.
