Ciitizen is now Invitae, bringing together the power of genomic and clinical information within a new kind of patient data platform to improve healthcare decision making at personal and systemwide levels.  Ciitizen is a health technology platform that enables patients with cancer and rare neurologic disorders to collect, digitize, and share their health information. Funded by Andreessen-Horowitz and founded by serial entrepreneur and former Head of Health at Apple (Anil Sethi), it began with the simple idea that anyone should be able to manage their own medical records but was motivated by the harder reality of helping Anil's own sister fight her battle with cancer.  Our mission is for patients to control their healthcare data so that they can control their healthcare options.  In this role, you help build our unstructured data extraction pipeline. You will be responsible for leveraging the latest machine learning and NLP technology to structure and normalize data from medical records. You like digging into messy data, working with clinical subject matter experts to develop annotation guidelines to produce high-quality machine learning models. You will touch all parts of the machine learning project lifecycle from dataset curation to model deployment.  What you will do:   Formulate healthcare data structuring challenges into ML/NLP solvable problems  Innovate and ideate novel ML/NLP-driven solutions for structuring healthcare data  Create prototypes and collaborate with engineering for successful product integration and testing  Measure and evaluate the performance and present results to stakeholders  Collaborate with clinicians and ML/NLP experts to unlock new capabilities   Requirements:   Masters in Computer Science or a related field with at least two years of work experience prototyping and deploying NLP / ML models or PhD/graduate with a focus on NLP.  Proficiency with Python.  In Depth knowledge of state-of-the-art DL techniques and architectures such as Transformers, RNN, etc and practical knowledge of pre-trained neural language models such as BERT, ROBERTa, etc.  Familiarity with open source ML/DL frameworks (Pytorch, TensorFlow, Keras)  Demonstrated experience developing solutions for NLP tasks such as Topic Modeling, Classification, Named Entity Recognition, or Named Entity Linking.  Experience with dockerizing code and launching them on cloud.  Only accepting US Based applicants at this time.   # LI - Remote  At Invitae, we value diversity and provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

This role is not open to remote applicants and would require relocation to Seattle, WA.  A-Alpha Bio Summary  A-Alpha Bio is a synthetic biology and machine learning company that measures and engineers protein-protein interactions to generate high-resolution models of biology for drug discovery. We work independently and with industry leading pharma and biotech partners to enable the discovery of antibodies, molecular glues, and other high impact therapeutics.  Role Description  A-Alpha Bio is seeking an experienced and highly motivated Director of Research to lead a team of Scientists responsible for the execution of research initiatives involving the discovery, optimization, and characterization of antibody therapeutics and other biotherapeutics. The Director of Research will be responsible for the development, prioritization, and management of complex internal research initiatives involving synthetic biology, antibody engineering, pre-clinical drug development, and machine learning. The role will also work closely with the Project Management and Business Development teams to determine feasibility, bandwidth constraints, ownership, and execution of external partnerships, and collaborations. Success in this position requires the ability to prioritize based on key strategic objectives, synthesize complex issues into actionable solutions, and effectively and persuasively communicate to diverse stakeholders including the executive team and Board of Directors. The ideal candidate will have significant management experience in a highly technical environment and must be passionate about being a strong advocate for their team. This position will report directly to the Chief Technology Officer.  Responsibilities   Grow and manage a high performing team consisting of Scientists and Research Associates across synthetic biology, drug discovery, and protein engineering fields  Build upon and execute a technology development roadmap for the development of a cutting-edge antibody discovery and optimization workflow  Oversee external partnerships in the antibody discovery and optimization space and feasibility studies for novel biotherapeutics applications  Work with stakeholders across multiple functional groups to establish the biologics portfolio discovery strategy  Work closely with the Data & Computational Sciences teams to leverage cutting-edge AI/ML tools for antibody discovery and engineering  Identify, assess, and champion opportunities for vertical or horizontal integration  Challenge team think, proactively anticipate risks, and develop mitigation strategies  Work closely with Head of Technical Operations to prioritize technology transfer initiatives from R&D into a production environment  Participate in the publication of research papers and filing of patents  Obsess over innovation and think years into the future   Requirements   Ph.D. in Life/Chemical/Physical/Engineering Sciences  Direct experience in antibody discovery and optimization using next-generation tools  Direct experience in at least one of the following areas: antibody or protein engineering, drug discovery, NGS-based assays, synthetic biology, data science and machine learning  Impressive technical track record at leading pharma/biotech companies  5+ years of industry experience and 3+ of management experience  Strong interpersonal and verbal / written communication skills  Strong problem-solving skills and creativity  Experience directly leading and managing R&D teams in a cross-functional and fast-paced environment  Experience managing, collaborating with, and recruiting top-tier scientists   We offer competitive compensation including a pay package, benefits, and equity in a fast-growing start-up. Job title will be set based on experience and track record, so we encourage applicants with a wide range of backgrounds to apply. Applicants must have legal authorization to work in the United States.  About A-Alpha Bio  A-Alpha Bio is an early-stage biotechnology company combining synthetic biology and machine learning to dramatically improve the discovery of high-impact therapeutics. We believe that abundant high-quality data is critical for understanding biology and curing disease – and synthetic biology is our catalyst. Our proprietary AlphaSeq platform uses genetically engineered cells to quantitatively measure millions of protein interactions – from which we generate high-resolution models of biology.  In 2018, we spun out of the University of Washington's Institute for Protein Design and Center for Synthetic Biology – both fantastic communities of brilliant and highly entrepreneurial scientist. Initial financial support came from the National Science Foundation, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and a seed round in September 2019 led by OS Fund. Since the company's inception, we have focused on partnering with pharmaceutical companies to discover and optimize drugs for therapeutic areas ranging from infectious disease to cancer. We are growing rapidly, and new members of the team should expect a fast-paced and highly dynamic work environment. We are building a diverse, meritocratic, and supportive team that values hard work, creativity, transparency, individual and team growth, flexibility, and kindness.  A-Alpha Bio is headquartered in Seattle at Fluke Hall, a startup incubator operated by the University of Washington (although, we will be moving soon!). While the startup lifestyle occasionally requires grueling hours, we strongly value the need for a work-life balance and time out of the lab/office. We are fortunate to be situated in a region that is renowned for its premier outdoor activities, including hiking, biking, climbing, skiing, kayaking, and sailing. At A-Alpha, you'll find many who love the outdoors, but also gamers, bakers, photographers, brewers, jetsetters, animal lovers, and artists. Whatever your passions, you belong at A-Alpha Bio.

The project has great visibility across the company with upcoming showcases to the industry.        The xLabs experience is the perfect place for developers looking to blaze new trails, work on a high impact project and to see it through to a real product. We are seeking an experienced architect or developer who will build projects and solutions based on cloud native application security, machine learning (ML) technologies and the VMware product family. The Senior Data Scientist, Marketing has significant experience using current Data Science toolsets and techniques to solve complicated optimization problems across the organization. This role has a major impact on REI’s bottom line as well as significant contributions to our exciting Membership, Social Impact and Environmental priorities!      The Senior Data Scientist, Marketing is a creative and passionate problem-solver who thinks big, understands the details, acts quickly, and is motivated to develop new approaches to optimizing REI’s business using statistical methods, machine learning algos, and cutting-edge technology. The role requires strong experience solving difficult Marketing and interrelated and interdependent opportunities. The role will deliver real improvements and will have a solid understanding of the downstream consequences that upstream process changes can have. Models and acts in accordance with REI’s guiding values and mission.      As a Senior Data Scientist, Marketing, will you:           Opportunities and problems are somewhat ambiguous or semi-structured. Defines problem and method approach as part of a team.       Influences specific teams and products. Works closely with product and business teams. Able to build consensus. Advises Sr. Manager/Director levels. Actively mentors/develops others.       Problems are complex to solve, approached with an understanding of the interactions among software systems, data, and processes. Ability to select an ideal solution from a wide range of data science methodologies.       Takes the lead on medium to large projects, requiring both business and technical domain knowledge and expertise. Delivers significant benefit to business.       Successfully launches data science solutions for the business with minimal assistance.       Drives scientific understanding and changes in related systems. Makes technical trade-offs for long term/short-term needs.                Bring your passion and expertise                 MS + 4 years’ experience or BS + 8 years’ experience        5+ years’ experience implementing large scale end-to-end marketing programs        Experience working with raw and prepared data sources in a variety of RDBMS systems (Snowflake, Oracle, TeraData, Redshift etc) and NoSQL environments such as Hadoop, Spark, Athena        Knowledge of and experience working within cloud computing environments such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Fluency with statistical and machine learning algorithms such as decision trees, neural networks, collaborative filtering, clustering, survival analysis, graph theory, etc.        Understands challenges in business area, applicability of relevant data science disciplines, and system interactions.        Ability to successfully communicate ideas and sell strategic plans to senior executives while influencing adoption and successful implementation        Able to keep others current on current scientific advancements.        Actively participates and collaborates with others on one's own team and across REI for the achievement of business goals        Uses business knowledge, innovative thinking, and sound judgment in the solution of problems or the pursuit of business opportunities.        Executes effectively by using resources efficiently, meeting deadlines, and keeping others informed of work plans and progress toward goals.        Consolidates information from various sources including feedback from others to reach sound decisions.        Clearly conveys and accurately receives information by a variety of methods and in various situations.        Acts upon opportunities and involves and influences others in the accomplishment of worthwhile organizational goals. job_title: Senior Machine Learning Architect - Data Science
job_Description: Senior Machine Learning Architect Data ScienceSeattle Description We are looking for an enthusiastic Senior AI/ML Architect to add to Credera’s Data Science capability group. Our ideal candidate is excited about leading project-based teams in a client facing role to analyze large data sets to derive insights through machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) techniques. They have strong experience in data preparation and analysis using a variety of tools and programming techniques, building and implementing models, and creating and running simulations. The AI/ML architect should be familiar with the deployment of enterprise scale models into a production environment; this includes leveraging full development lifecycle best practices for both cloud and on-prem solutions across a variety of use cases. You will act as the primary architect and technical lead on projects to scope and estimate work streams, architect and model technical solutions to meet business requirements and serve as a technical expert in client communications. On a typical day, you might expect to participate in design sessions, build statistical models for a machine learning algorithm, provision environments, coach junior resources, and manage technical logs and release management tools. Additionally, you will seek out new business development opportunities at existing and new clients.  WHO YOU ARE: Proven experience in the architecture, design, and implementation of large scale and enterprise grade AI/ML solutions 7+ years of hands-on statistical modeling and/or analytical experience in and industry or consulting setting Master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or related field (a PhD is preferred) Experience with a variety of ML and AI techniques (e.g. multivariate/logistic regression models, cluster analysis, predictive modeling, neural networks, deep learning, pricing models, decision trees, ensemble methods, etc.) Advanced skillset building models and performing analysis using scripting languages (Python, R, Scala, Octave) Advanced knowledge of relational and non-relational databases (SQL, NoSQL) Proficient in large-scale distributed systems (Hadoop, Spark, etc.) Experience with designing and presenting compelling insights using visualization tools (RShiny, R, Python, Tableau, Power BI, D3.js, etc.) Passion for leading teams and providing both formal and informal mentorship Experience with wrangling, exploring, transforming, and analyzing datasets of varying size and complexity Knowledgeable of tools and processes to monitor model performance and data quality, including model tuning experience Strong communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to engage customers at a business level in addition to a technical level Stay current with AI/ML trends and research; be a thought leader in AI area Experience with implementing machine learning models in production environments through one or more cloud platforms: Google Cloud Platform Azure cloud services AWS cloud services  WHO WE ARE: Credera is a full-service management consulting, user experience, and technology solutions firm, with clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to emerging industry leaders Credera has received a number of state and national awards, including: Fortune's Best Workplaces in Consulting & Professional Services Fortune's Best Workplaces in Texas Fortune’s Best Workplaces for Millennials Top Workplaces USA The Denver Post’s Top Workplaces The Dallas Morning News’ Top 100 Places to Work The Houston Business Journal Best Place to Work List Our data capabilities help our clients gain competitive advantage by transforming raw data into insights that enable actionable decision making. Our business-driven approach to envisioning and implementing innovative solutions helps organizations tackle their market, increase customer engagement and grow revenue profitably via advanced technology. Our data capabilities serve our clients across a broad spectrum of areas, specializing in Data Strategy, Modern Data Architecture, Data Visualization, Business Insights, Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence.  HOW WE WORK: We work in small (typically 2-8 person) project teams that collaborate closely with clients to solve their toughest challenges We employ principles of agile development to achieve high velocity and quality of delivery We offer several channels for collaboration that make it easy to reach out to leaders within the practice We adhere to Credera’s core values of integrity, excellence, professionalism, and humility at all times  Travel:  Like what you hear but you're worried about high travel? Know that our goal is to keep travel to a minimum and most projects do not require travel. An average would be 0% up to 30%. Basic Qualifications Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, client-facing role where delivering solid work products to exceed high expectations is a measure of success Contribute in a team-oriented environment Prioritize multiple tasks in order to consistently meet deadlines Creatively solve problems in an analytical environment Adapt to new environments, people, technologies and processes Excel in leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills Establish strong work relationships with clients and team members Generate ideas and understand different points of view Learn More We do not currently commence "sponsor" immigration cases in order to employ candidates. Credera is a management consulting, user experience, and technology solutions firm with offices in Dallas, Denver, Houston, Chicago, and New York. We work with clients ranging from Fortune 500 companies to emerging industry leaders, and provide expert, objective advice to help solve complex business and technology challenges. Our deep capabilities in strategy, organization, process, analytics, technology and user experience help our clients improve their performance. Clients depend on our ability to anticipate, recognize, and address their specific needs. Credera’s consultants work with some of the world’s best known brands in a variety of industries, including one of the top five fast food chains, leading energy organizations, retailers, airlines. More information is available at www.credera.com. We are part of the OPMG Group of Companies, a division of Omnicom Group Inc. Along with a great company culture, Credera provides an outstanding compensation package including a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefit plan (e.g., medical, dental, disability, matching 401k, PTO, etc.). This position is an exempt position.

Pivotal Commware develops 5G communications platforms, systems and applications based on Holographic Beam Forming® , a patented breakthrough in electromagnetic physics. HBF allows Pivotal to create software-defined antennas that can harness, shape and direct radio waves with order-of magnitude advantages over legacy beamforming systems in cost, size, weight and power consumption (C-SWaP). HBF enables mobile network operators to maximize capacity, coverage and throughput on demand and is recognized as an essential element in the 5G ecosystem. 5G leadership is pivotal to the US economy, and 5G is Pivotal™.                  Pivotal is seeking an      Antenna Research Engineer  to drive advanced research programs in a principal investigator role. The candidate will be responsible for the design and analysis of Holographic Beamforming Antennas as well as advancing the state of the art in RF Hologram optimization.             The successful candidate will demonstrate the ability to think creatively and to operate within a flexible, fast-paced program dedicated to advancing the state of the art in RF Holographic Beamforming. This position reports to the CTO.                             Responsibilities             Advance the state of the art for optimal design of holographic beamforming antennas. Projects are focused on progressing technical concepts from ideation (TRL1) to ready for product integration (TRL6).  Use full-wave solvers (Ansys HFSS), semi-analytical approaches, and numerical models to validate theoretical approaches. Follow up with experimental and prototype demonstrations of new capability.  Develop proposals and recommendations to augment the investigative team with critical capabilities and open new avenues of investigation.                          Required Qualifications             PhD or Masters with 4+ years industry experience as an Electrical Engineer, RF Engineer, Antenna Engineer, Research Engineer, R&D Engineer or related title.  A critical understanding of diffractive metasurface techniques and their applications.  Hands on experience with millimeter-wave metrology tools (VNA, Spectrum Analyzer, Vector Signal Generator, standard gain horns, etc…) and techniques (antenna substitution, link analysis, reference planes, calibration).  Experience using modeling tools such as Microwave Studio, Ansoft HFSS or similar.  Basic software skills in C, C++ and/or MATLAB.  Excellent communication skills and coordinate with a cross-disciplinary team throughout all phases of development.                          Desirable Expertise             Experience troubleshooting embedded hardware and software interfaces is very useful for working hands on with HBF devices and test platforms.  Experience with phased-arrays, leaky-wave antennas, electrically steered arrays, or MIMO beamformers can be helpful but an HBF is not any of these.  Knowledge of stochastic methods, linear analysis, and numerical methods is useful for design of experiments.                         Pivotal was named among Washington’s Top 100 Places to Work in 2018, 2019, 2020 & 2021. At Pivotal you will join a team experienced in advanced communications, RAN system development and deployment, commercial antenna’s, RF design, cloud-based management software and machine learning. If you want to apply yourself to this fascinating endeavor, then we would like to hear from you!                                Pivotal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce.

The Identity Security Team is responsible for ensuring the integrity and security of the services we operate (Azure Active Directory & Microsoft Account), as well as the consumer and commercial identities we manage. Each day, our detection systems and machine learning algorithms evaluate and risk score more than 18 billion logins daily for more than 800 million customers monthly (including for O365, Xbox, OneDrive, & Azure). In addition to ensuring the veracity of interactions powering the global digital economy, our efforts are at the core of Microsoft’s commitment to defend democracy worldwide.              We are seeking a talented individual to join our world-class team of investigators and data scientists – your passion for protecting customers, comfort with ambiguity, and motivation to deliver consistently exceptional performance under high pressure, will be highly valued. Your ability to efficiently sift through PB sized datasets via automation to extract key insights in a timely manner, will be critical in helping us continue to successfully execute against our mission. We are experiencing unprecedented business growth so if you are motivated by the challenge of using your skills & knowledge to help protect nearly a billion people worldwide, come join us!              #IdentityJobs       Responsibilities        Respond to security incidents (on-call) spanning both operational issues and customer identity compromise or fraud so as to identify, isolate, remediate, and root cause     Investigate security incidents and find patterns ensuring we adapt our systems and develop/improve automated timely detections     Continually evaluate and improve existing algorithms, and create new ones, to detect and prevent systemic service vulnerabilities, identity compromise, fraud, and abuse     Identify and analyze new data sources to find novel patterns that can be transformed into new automated detections     Conceptualize, implement and analyze metrics to assess the quality of our detections and improve in real time     Develop and enhance data analytics pipelines for cybersecurity and/or fraud investigations     Collaborate with engineering and partner teams cross-company in achieving our objectives       Qualifications         Required            2+ years' experience as a data scientist, software engineer, or security researcher      BS Degree in Computer Science, Electrical & Computer Engineering or Mathematics or equivalent experience            Preferred Qualifications:            Previous experience in any of the following: identity systems, security, threat intelligence, fraud, abuse  Outstanding math and statistics skills with demonstrated applied machine learning and/or analytics experience      An ability to drive good decisions through data with great attention to detail and excellent logical problem-solving skills      Proven experience with rapid prototyping, evaluation, and iterative improvement      Proficiency with one of more of Python, SQL, Java, C#, C++      Proficiency in interacting with big data infrastructure and resultant pipelines to perform NRT/batch analytics (e.g. Kafka, Spark, Azure Cosmos DB, HDInsight, Hadoop)      Graduate degree in computer science, machine learning, statistics, or quantitative domain      Strong communication skills with a demonstrated bias towards collaboration and team work            Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:              Microsoft Cloud Background Check: This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud Background Check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.              Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form. At Ericsson Routes we believe that connectivity is critical for mobility - and we are part of creating that future with our mission to be the first stop in any connected mobility journey - starting right here, right now with the autonomous vehicle industry. Ericsson Routes is the Waze for wireless cellular quality. It allows autonomous vehicles, drones, and other connected vehicles to take a route from point A to point B that provides the highest-quality wireless connectivity along the way. As our new Data Scientist, you will be responsible for developing new intelligence for Ericsson Routes through applied research. You’ll work hand in hand with the rest of our top performance team and in close collaboration with Ericsson’s top engineering and research teams to drive innovation and industry disruption. Our focus is on Lean and Agile ways of working. We organize in cross functional development teams in which continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing is part of the daily work. Flexe solves the hardest omnichannel logistics problems for the world’s largest retailers and brands. Integrating technology, open logistics networks, and elastic economic models allows Flexe customers to move fast, at scale, and with precision. Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Seattle, Flexe brings deep logistics expertise and enterprise-grade technology to deliver innovative eCommerce fulfillment, retail distribution, same-day delivery, and network capacity programs to the Fortune 500. Flexe is transforming the      $1.6T  logistics industry.                  Flexe is looking for a      Senior Data Scientist  to analyze, model, prototype, and release customer-facing products leveraging Flexe’s trove of data. As Flexe redefines the logistics inventory through its products offering Capacity, Distribution, Fulfillment, and Transportation, we are looking for a Data Scientist with a passion for data modeling and predictive analytics. This role is part of a newly formed team within Flexe dedicated to identifying business insights and turning them into value-additive products for Flexe’s customers.                  You will be guiding innovative research while prototyping data-driven products to create and deliver a roadmap that everyone can rally around in our fast-paced organization while working with a team of other hardworking and motivated professionals. You will partner closely with Product & Engineering, Analytics, Finance, Operations, and Revenue Operations to identify and harvest data to power machine learning and optimization models. Candidates should be passionate about predictive analytics and will possess a strong sense of intellectual curiosity. While logistics experience is a plus, a passion for data and machine learning will be the primary key to success on this team.                    What You'll Do:             Ideate, build, test, and release machine learning models to provide Flexe customers with insights and recommendations to improve their supply chains  Create experiments and prototype implementations of new learning algorithms and prediction techniques  Analyze and interpret large amounts of data from various internal sources  Formalize assumptions about model behavior, creating definitions for outliers, detection methods for those outliers, and explaining if the outliers are reasonable or not  Communicating verbally and in writing to business customers with various levels of technical knowledge, and sharing insights and recommendations  Utilizing scripting code (Python, R, etc.) to analyze data and build statistical and machine learning models  Collaborating with analysts, engineers, product managers, and stakeholders to design and implement software solutions for science problems                          Does This Sound Like You:             Master’s (or PhD degree) in a quantitative field such as Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, or Economics or 7+ years relevant experience  Fluency in a scripting language (R, python, etc.)  5+ years of hands-on experience in predictive modeling, analysis, and machine learning  2+ years of relevant working experience in an analytical role involving data extraction, statistical modeling, and communication  2+ years of experience with data querying languages (SQL)  Proficiency in model development, model validation and model implementation for large-scale applications  Ability to convey mathematical results to non-science stakeholders  Strength in clarifying and formalizing complex problems  Natural curiosity and desire to learn, a passion for solving real world problems                         #LI-AS             #LI-REMOTE                  Benefits:              The benefits package at Flexe is thoughtfully designed to help people lead healthy lives in and outside of work.                   Health benefits for individual:      -Dental and vision are covered 100%      -Medical is covered 100% for HSA or a small premium for PPO.      401k Matching Program      Internet Stipend, while we're 100% work from home      $300 Work from home office reimbursement      20 days of PTO       13 Total Holidays      -10 company holidays (We've added Juneteenth to our list of holidays observed)      -2 floating holidays      -Take your birthday off!       Paid Parental Leave & Bereavement Leave       Paid Volunteer Time      Industry learning initiatives with talks, demos, site visits. Etc.                   Working at Flexe:              Here are a few perks that make day to day work at Flexe even more enjoyable:                   Choice of MacBook or PC and monitor setup, and height adjustable standing desk      Located in historic Pioneer Square; restaurants, bars, shops, and mass transit hub      PhilanthroFlexe program. job_title: Director of Advertiser and Industry Analytics
job_Description: Microsoft Search Advertising empowers advertisers around the world to reach their maximum potential through multiple channel offerings including paid search, native, display, gaming, and video. Our global adveritsing network is vast, expansive, and growing – reaching hundreds of millions of users on a daily basis all over the world. Our data sets are large, complex, and unique helping us enable our advertisers to better understand their customers and their business opportunities in online advertising and beyond. As a part of Microsoft, our technology and tools are world-class, enabling our teams to execute at scale and drive innovation in analytics, visulation, machine learning, and much more. Our people are the heart-beat of our team, bringing together a diverse set of skills and experiences that create unrivaled analytical experiences for our customers.       Responsibilities        In this role as the Head of Advertiser Analytics for North America, this leader will help set up the long-term strategy for meeting the analytics needs of our North American customer base in direct partnership with our Technology, Enablement, and Advertising Sales teams. This leader will also be responsible for the execution of our North American Analytical Leads, who partner directly with our customers to solve analytical problems and drive incremental business impact for both our customers and our North American markets. This leader will engage across our Advertising leadership, and beyond, to represent the analytics needs of our customer base – navigating complexities in data-related privacy initiatives, big-data management, machine learning challenges, and communciating all of that complexity directly to customers. This leader will possess and deploy a very strong understanding of the various technical disciplines and capabilities necessary to meet the needs of a diverse customer base – with an empahsis on methodological and inferential approaches that will answer questions about impact incrementality in a crowded ads space, relationships between online and offline behaviors, the role of macro-economic dynamics on e-commerce centric industries, and much, much more. This leader will have a strong understanding of our competition and their offerings, both in objective and analytial capacity – both leveraging their strengths while also differentiating where iut truly counts. This leader will build upon a culture that is inculsive while managing an exceedingly agile operational model with our sales, technology, and international counter-parts.              Your Responsibilities and Impact               As      an      Organizational and      People Leader            Attract and lead a diverse analyitcs organization, including Director-level managers and Analytical Leads, all focused on delivering business success to our customers through high quality and sophisticated analytics.      Foster an inclusive environment focused on respect, accountability, collaboration, trust, and mutual learning while managing an agile operating model      Build a strong team identity, understanding and representing the unique experiences and needs of the North American Analytical Leads team both as a group and individually      Coach the team to maximum impact across our diverse customer base, ensuring strong execution and clarity on expectations and opportunities      Model what it means to be an innovative and world-class analyst and people leader, energizing your team to reach new heights in solving customer challenges      Partner with other organizational leaders to ensure strong collaboration across related work-groups, ensuring a customer centric focus and inclusive environment               As a     n           Analyitics      Leader            Ensure a relentless customer centric and agile operating approach that meets our business objectives through a deep understanding of our customer needs – this includes, but is not limited to, a deep and technical understanding of our data sets, their use cases, relevant data and statistical models, and communicating interpretations in a clear, objective, and trust-worthy manner      Lead our evolution as an analytics organization by increasing our ability to innovate in our methods, visulations, inferences, and broader capabilities.      Parter across peer organizations to find common use cases for our centralized enablement and technology organizations, enabling your team to be even more productive, efficient, and impactful               As a Business Leader            Identify and communicate key customer trends and needs, both in the marketing and advertising analytics space, but also in regards to the dynamics of their industries and resulting challenges we can help them solve.      Work with other leaders across the business to make resourcing and investment decisions across our people, technology, and customer bases      Synthesize complex organizational and operational dynamics into insights that can be used to improve effectiveness of our business beyond the scope of the organization being managed      Work with partners, particularly in Sales, to ensure strong alignment on priorities and engagement model to ensure strong growth in the impact of the team and the relationships between our teams           Qualifications         Job      Require     ments     : Education, Key Experiences, Skills and Knowledge:            Minimum 10 years of relevant business, advertising, or marketing focused analytics experience; preferably in a customer facing capacity      Minimum 6 years’ people management experience; manager of manager experience preferred but not required      Bachelor’s degree or 10 years of relevant experience required; Master’s degree (or greater) in an analytical, statistical, data science, economics, or applied research field preferred      Proven track record of exceptional performance, measured against quantitative business outcomes, analytical operational efficiencies, team-cultural development, change management      Ability to coach team members to high standards of execution in utilizing analytical tools to derive transformative insights from large, dynamic data sets      Experience pairing data visualization with storytelling to deliver persuasive presentations that influence varying audience levels.      Ability to coach team members to high standards of analytical communication, spanning a mix of both technical and non-technical partners and customers.      Ability to coach team members to high standards of execution using more than one of the following data manipulation and visualization tools: Python, R, SQL, PowerBI, Tableau, DAX, PowerPivot, Microsoft Advertising API.      Ability to coach team members to high standards of execution in predictive modeling, data clustering/classification techniques, media mix modeling, and other advanced analytical techniques      Demonstrated experience building high-trust cultures, managing and coaching high performing analytics teams      Clear enthusiasm for search, digital media and technology as levers to grow and transform businesses of all sizes      Demonstrated experience in guiding teams through ongoing and impactful business, market, and capability related change      Exceptional written and verbal communication and presentation skills, ability to scale across all levels of an organization      Solid knowledge of the advertising industry, trends, customers needs, Microsoft’s strategy and how they work together      Ability to travel up to 25% (air travel may be required), post-pandemic    #MicrosoftAdvertising               Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. • Experience managing Business Intelligence Engineers, Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and/or Business Analysts. • Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related business/analytical disciplines • 5+ years of industry experience in Business Intelligence, Data Science, Data Engineering, Software Development, or related field with a track record of producing actionable business insights from large datasets.        Job summary    Do you want to be at the forefront of driving a global and thriving business? Do you like to build processes from the ground to deliver value to Amazon customers? Come join the Amazon Accelerator team under Amazon Private Brands. In Accelerator, we enable manufacturers and brand owners across the world to create new brands exclusively for Amazon’s customers and offer them a unique opportunity to supply for Amazon Private Brands. We will create brands for products that span all categories and deliver great value to customers globally.        We’re looking for a Manager, BIE who can help us drive data solutions across the Private Brands business. You will own building the Business Intelligence Roadmap, partnering with business stakeholders, data engineering, and software engineering teams to drive best-in-class business intelligence solutions at scale. You will work with structured and unstructured data sources to develop deep business insights and architect key business metrics.         Key job responsibilities            Hire, manage, coach and lead a high performing team of Business Intelligence Engineers.      Engage with leadership and diversified stakeholder groups to understand their data and analytics needs and recommend BI solutions.      Design, implement, and support platforms that provide business teams ad-hoc access to large datasets (e.g. data visualization tools for non-tech business users).      Own the design, development, and maintenance of ongoing performance metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions. Standardize data and report consumption across all customer groups.      Recognize and adopt best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation.      Proactively develop new metrics and studies to quantify safety risks, growth and identify program opportunities.      Work with Data Engineering, Machine learning, and Software Development teams to drive capture and storage of key data points, and on implementation of new dashboards/analyses.      Conduct written and verbal presentation to share insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication.          • MS in Computer Science, Computer/Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field. • Hands-on experience with SQL and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.). • Strong business acumen, verbal and written communication skills and demonstrated technical leadership. • Works well in a dynamic team environment and is able to effectively drive cross-team solutions having complex dependencies and requirements. • Excellent communication skills to summarize insights and recommendations to audiences of varying levels of technical sophistication. • Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals. • Experience working with AWS big data technologies (Redshift, S3, EMR). • Demonstrated ability to write complex, optimized SQL queries across large data sets. • Proficiency in at least one programming language used for data science such as Python, R, etc. • Experience delivering technology products and services in a high growth environment where priorities shift fast. job_title: Backend Software Engineer, Mineral at X, The Moonshot Factory
job_Description: X is Alphabet’s moonshot factory. We are a diverse group of inventors and entrepreneurs who build and launch technologies that aim to improve the lives of millions, even billions, of people. Our goal: 10x impact on the world’s most intractable problems, not just 10% improvement. We approach projects that have the aspiration and riskiness of research with the speed and ambition of a startup. About the Team: Modern agriculture faces an enormous array of challenges, as growers must produce more food on the same or smaller amounts of land, using fewer inputs, all while competing with unrelenting pressure from disease, pests, and a changing climate. Solving these problems demands radical new thinking. How you will make an Impact: Designing and implementing backend and database for machine learning products, and computing platform APIs for industry customers. Being a thoughtful engineer on the key decisions on software architecture, technology roadmap, and execution of the project. Seeing through a project from conception to finished product, and meeting both technical and consumer needs. What you should have: BA/BS degree (In lieu of degree, relevant skills or equivalent experience). Experience with database and api design and implementation. Experience with cloud infrastructure, e.g., Dataflow, Storage (GCS/S3), PubSub, etc. It would be great if you also had these: Willing to work in a fast-paced, start-up like environment. Fast learner who is able to think through and adapt to new problems quickly. Strong team player with excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience working on large-scale consumer facing products and handling large traffic. Experience working with Google Cloud AppEngine and One Platform. Good understanding in basic computer vision and machine learning methods. (Note: this role will not directly work on machine learning tasks, but will instead collaborate with the ML training team to deliver products to customers.) About X, the moonshot factory X creates radical new technologies to solve some of the world’s biggest problems. We develop uncomfortably ambitious, potentially world-changing new ideas such as self-driving cars, balloon-powered Internet and smart contact lenses. We’re a team of makers, entrepreneurs, engineers, designers and scientists with deep technical expertise who love the challenge of the seemingly impossible. X was formerly known as Google[x] and is part of Alphabet. At X, we don't just accept difference - we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. Microsoft 365 is one of the largest enterprise services in the world and security and customer trust are key to the success of our business and its continued growth. The Microsoft 365 security monitoring team uses machine learning, heuristics, and statistical analysis on a cutting edge big data platform to provide real-time security alerts. We also create highly scalable automated remediation systems to “fight back” in the event of an attack.                    In this fast paced and highly visible role, you will own the monitoring and remediation strategy for a variety of threats within M365. This will involve working deeply with partners across the organization to understand the security risks. You will work closely with our engineering teams to design and implement new monitoring and remediation features to catch and mitigate these scenarios.       Responsibilities     The primary responsibilities for this role will include the following:         Work with partner teams to understand risk scenarios and data requirements.      Documenting and road mapping end to end security strategies to address various high-risk personas.      Work with engineering teams to design and implement new detections, remediations and data flows.      Use data analytics tools, big data processing and machine learning techniques to analyze threat signatures and build algorithms to catch them.      Work with security incident responders to drive security monitoring and remediation follow ups from incidents.        Qualifications        You do NOT need security experience to start in this role. We can teach you! The ideal candidate will have these Basic Qualifications:              2+ years of experience in a program management/product management role              1+ years of experience using data analysis tools such as SQL, Kusto, Jupyter Notebook, etc.              Bonus points if you have experience in these Preferred Qualifications:           Big data processing and analytics      A “start up” mentality - the determination to move fast, ask questions, and drive maximum impact with what you are given.      Proven ability to operate across and influence multiple teams while managing stakeholders at various management levels.      Strong communication skills, including the ability to drive plans/roadmaps at the exec level      A willingness to “dive deep” and analyze data using SQL, Kusto, Jupyter Notebook, etc.      Machine learning or statistical analysis      Familiarity with cybersecurity topics including security monitoring, incident response, authentication, authorization or threat models.           Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. job_title: Senior Software Engineer (Machine learning) - Recommendations Team (Remote Eligible)
job_Description: We are looking for a  Senior Software Engineer  (Sr. SE) to join the Recommendations team. The Recommendation team is working on a core feature for Smartsheet to help our users leverage the full potential of the product. In this team, you will build a machine learning framework that powers a recommendation engine that helps users learn the full potential of our product.  In 2005, Smartsheet was founded on the idea that teams and millions of people worldwide deserve a better way to deliver their very best work. Today, we deliver a leading cloud-based platform for work execution, empowering organizations to plan, capture, track, automate, and report on work at scale, resulting in more efficient processes and better business outcomes.  You will report to an Engineering leader in our Bellevue office, and you have the option to work remotely from any Smartsheet registered location within the United States. Job #2660: Chameleon Technologies is searching for a Senior Python Engineer for a position in Santa Monica, CA. Our client is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, parking information, connected car services, and mobility analytics. They leverage technology and data to make it safer, cleaner, and more enjoyable for people to get to where they need to go.  They’re an awesome place to work: located in the heart of Santa Monica and have flexible work hours, unlimited PTO, lots of snacks and drinks, a dog-friendly office, an on-site gym, quarterly team outings, and catered Friday lunches. They’re a small, focused team, so we operate like an agile startup but also have the support of their head office in Seattle.?  Our work is diverse. Although we all specialize in certain areas, we strive for everyone to be knowledgeable of our systems.? We support each other as a team and never stop learning and exploring.? As a senior engineer, you will support others in their growth and learning from day 1 and you will set an example of story and project ownership.  Once you are familiar with our system and you have grown into this role, you will :  Help drivers find parking by analyzing geospatial information online and offline.  Work independently in a Python/Django code base, translating product goals into a productionized implementation and documentation, with tests.  Work on separating our monolith into microservices and porting them to Kubernetes.  Add new features to our existing endpoints, while improving the extensibility of the system.  Monitor and optimize endpoints that serve millions of requests per hour for very demanding customers (premium auto manufacturers).  Become comfortable deploying code with uptime and latency requirements, using HA infrastructure and SRE principles.  Add new functionality to our internal and external sites, using Vue.js frontend code centered around Mapbox and Google Maps widgets, with Python and Node backends.  Design event-driven mechanisms to process terabyte-sized datasets with low latency.  Collaborate closely with data scientists on machine learning and computer vision for street-level awareness.  Answer critical business questions with graphs and maps.  Be part of the on-call rotation because you are confident that you can solve most problems or find the person who can. We average a few out-of-hours warnings and alarms a month, and we are always looking to reduce that.??  Apply the scientific method, posing and rejecting hypotheses as the team investigates complexities in our system.  Build expertise in the tech we use: Django 2+3, Vue.js, NATS Streaming, Kubernetes, Prometheus, AWS ECS and Beanstalk, Postgres/Postgis, Redis, AWS Batch, EMR, and Spark.?  About you :  Have 3 years of Python experience, or experience in similar languages and a good understanding of Python.  Have a degree in computer science, or equivalent professional experience (boot camps count towards that).  You have experience with at least two of: machine learning, geospatial systems, API development, or DevOps.  Are a great communicator and team player who likes working with other engineers, product managers, and designers?  Like wearing several hats – we’re a small team and flexibility counts.  You have experience mentoring people in a professional setting.  You have experience owning a project and successfully completing it.  You like to develop an idea all the way through to a production-ready product, including the parts that are not coding.  Benefits:  Work with an amazing team with a focus on being the best and making the world a better place.  Solve complex real-world problems with big data.  Competitive Salary, Benefits, and 401K matching.  Open vacation policy, it’s unlimited and always has been.  Free parking right by the beach!  Plethora of snacks, drinks, lunches, and opportunities for folks to get to know other people in the company.  The people and passion. Meet and work with people that are smart, helpful, and love what they’re doing and geek out on it. Have the opportunity to make a big impact to both the company and our customers.

job_title: Post Doc Researcher – Systems, Operations Research, Algorithms– Microsoft Research
job_Description: The Cloud Operations Research (CORE) group in MSR-Redmond is looking for excellent postdoctoral researchers to work on exciting problems in the intersection of algorithms/ML, operations research, and computer systems. Our group focuses on designing large-scale optimization solutions for cloud systems and applications. Example projects include algorithms for dynamic resource allocation under uncertainty (e.g., for VM allocation) and intelligent supply chain management for the cloud. Another topic of interest is how to leverage machine learning in algorithm design and systems. More broadly, our research leverages theoretical insights for designing optimization algorithms that run efficiently at scale. Responsibilities As a postdoctoral researcher in MSR, you will define your own research agenda, driving forward an effective program of basic, fundamental, and applied research. In addition to driving your own research agenda, we highly value collaboration and building new ideas with members of the group and others. You have the direct opportunity to realize your ideas in products and services used worldwide. NOTE the following: This role is not to exceed two years. Qualifications Required Qualifications PhD (completed or close to completion) in Computer Science, Operations Research and or related field. Strong publication record in top tier conferences and or journals. Preferred Qualifications: Background in algorithm/optimization design Programming experience (C/C++/ C#/Java/Python Strong analytical and problem-solving skills The ability to work in a highly collaborative and interdisciplinary environment Background in CS systems and ML As part of your application please upload: CV, which lists all peer-reviewed publications. At least 3 reference letters (typically, one will be from your dissertation advisor) Research statement that outlines your research achievements and agenda. Assistant/Associate/Full Professor            Title:     270-NN - Assistant Professor           Business Title:     Assistant/Associate/Full Professor           Additional Titles:            Location:            Employee Type:     Faculty           Job Family:     Faculty - Academic - Not OT Eligible           Position Details:            COVID-19 Vaccine Information:         In accordance with Washington State Governor's Proclamation 21-14.1, as a condition of employment, all WSU employees must be fully vaccinated or have an approved medical/religious accommodation no later than October 18, 2021. People are considered fully vaccinated two weeks after receiving their last shot in a vaccine series. Vaccine or an approved accommodation for new employees will be verified no later than October 18, 2021. If the effective date of appointment is October 18, 2021 or later vaccine or approved accommodation status will be verified prior to first day of employment. Please reach out to Human Resource Services (HRS) at hrs@wsu.edu or    509-335-4521  if you have questions regarding this.           Summary of Duties:         The job duties of successful candidates at all levels include teaching undergraduate and graduate courses in electrical engineering; conducting funded research; publishing in top-tier venues; directing M.S. and Ph.D. student research programs; participating in the continuous teaching assessment activities of the School of EECS; effectively communicating and interacting with students; and collaborating with others within the School, the University, or other organizations including regional partners, such as the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory.        The new faculty hired for this position will join 37 existing tenure-track/tenured faculty members in the School of EECS, which has experienced rapid growth in enrollment over the past four years. Around the fall of 2020, approximately 1000 undergraduate students were enrolled in its B.S., and B.A. programs, and 275 graduate students are enrolled in its M.S., and Ph.D. programs in computer science, electrical engineering, and computer engineering. EECS expects continual increases in enrollment and anticipates multiple faculty hires over the next two years. The current faculty composition in the School of EECS includes a member of the National Academy of Engineering and ten fellows of national professional organizations as well as fourteen CAREER and Young Investigator award recipients.        WSU is recognized as a public university with "very high research activity" categorization from the Carnegie Foundation. Pullman is a quintessential college town-ranked #1 in the "Best Cities to Live in Washington" by the Washington state Chamber of Commerce 2019 report, one of the top 10 best college towns in the nation according to MSN's 2012 report; ranked #15 safest college town in America by a SafeWise 2019 report; and recognized by Bloomberg Businessweek as the "Best Place to Raise Kids" in Washington State. Pullman consistently boasts one of the top school districts in the state. Situated to the east of the Cascade Mountains, Pullman enjoys a dry four-season climate (21 inches of annual participation), with sunny, warm summers, relatively mild winters, and excellent access to outdoor recreational opportunities.        For more information about WSU and the School of EECS, visit our home page at www.eecs.wsu.edu.        The School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) at Washington State University (WSU) in Pullman, WA invites applications for multiple permanent full-time tenured/tenure-track faculty positions in Electrical Engineering at the assistant/associate/full professor level. Although all areas of electrical engineering will be considered, research emphasis will be on the following areas: power systems, power electronics, cybersecurity for power systems, and data analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence applied to power.        The electric power engineering program at WSU is ranked among the top five in the nation in number of faculty, students, and research expenditure. WSU's power program consists of twelve faculty members and four staff in EECS who specialize in teaching and research in electric power engineering. The group includes a member of the National Academy of Engineering and four fellows of IEEE. This core group is complemented by over 20 affiliated faculty members from other departments across the university together forming the multi-disciplinary research center, Energy Systems Innovation Center (ESIC) (https://esic.wsu.edu/). ESIC has a long tradition of close collaboration with regional power industry and is well-supported by two annual membership programs. The power program's annual research expenditures are about $4M, with approximately 40 graduate students and five post-docs and visiting researchers. WSU power faculty collaborate closely with the power industry, many research institutions around the world, and various government organizations.        Another strength of the WSU power program is the Advanced Grid Institute (AGI) which is a joint institute between WSU and the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory (PNNL) dedicated to modernizing the grid. (https://thewsu-pnnlinstitutes.labworks.org/advancedgrid/). AGI is envisioned to be the leader in modeling and simulation of the power grid to enable advanced controls and operations for the resilient sustainable power system of the future. WSU is also a member of the Power System Engineering Research Center (PSERC) that is a consortium of 12 leading universities and 27 industry partners, and of the Trustworthy Cyber Infrastructure for the Power Grid (TCIPG) that is a consortium of four universities and many industry partners.           Required Qualifications:         Candidates for    Assistant Professor  must have an earned Ph.D. degree in a reputable program in electrical engineering or a related field by the time of starting the position.        Candidates for    Associate Professor  must have an earned Ph.D. degree in a reputable program in electrical engineering or a related field by the time of hire and have a proven record of success as an Assistant Professor or equivalent experience in a National Lab or industry.        Candidates for the    full Professor  must have earned Ph.D. degree in a reputable program in electrical engineering or a related field by the time of hire and have a distinguished record of research success as an Associate Professor or equivalent experience in a National Lab or industry.           Candidates at all levels:             Must already have published impactful research work and demonstrate a strong commitment to building a world-class research and training program.        Should demonstrate a commitment to teaching excellence at both the undergraduate and graduate levels, and a commitment to diversifying the student body.        Must additionally have strong leadership qualities commensurate with the rank, as well as exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Required Skills            BS in computer science, or related technical, math, or scientific field     15+ years of professional experience in a business environment     10+ years of relevant experience in building large scale enterprise IT systems     5+ year of public cloud computing experience in AWS     3+ year of experience hosting and deploying ML solutions (e.g., for training, tuning, and inferences)     Machine Learning (ML) has been strategic to Amazon from the early years. We are pioneers in areas such as recommendation engines, product search, eCommerce fraud detection, and large-scale optimization of fulfillment center operations.      The ML team within AWS provides opportunities to innovate in a fast-paced organization that contributes to game-changing projects and technologies that get deployed on devices and the cloud. As a Deep Learning Architect, you'll partner with technology and business teams to build new services that surprise and delight our customers. You will be working with terabytes of text, images, and other types of data to solve real-world problems.      We’re looking for top architects, system and software engineers capable of using ML and other techniques to design, evangelize, and implement state-of-the-art solutions for never-before-solved problems.        The primary responsibilities of this role are to:          Use ML tools, such as Amazon SageMaker and Amazon Simple Storage Servcie, to provide a scalable cloud environment for our customers to label data, build, train, tune and deploy their models     Collaborate with our data scientists to create scalable ML solutions for business problems     Interact with customer directly to understand the business problem, help and aid them in implementation of their ML ecosystem     Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of historical data to help automate and optimize key processes     Work closely with account team, research scientist teams and product engineering teams to drive model implementations and new algorithms     This position requires travel of up to 30%.      About Us      Inclusive Team Culture   Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 14 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.      Work/Life Balance   Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.   Mentorship & Career Growth   Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and thorough, but kind, code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.      Preferred qualifications         Masters or PhD degree in computer science, or related technical, math, or scientific field     Strong working knowledge of deep learning, machine learning and statistics.     Hands on experience building models with deep learning frameworks like MXNet, Tensorflow, Caffe, Torch, Theano or similar.     Hands on experience with deep learning (e.g., CNN, RNN, LSTM)     Experience in using Python, R or Matlab or other statistical/machine learning software     Strong communication and data presentation skills     The motivation to achieve results in a fast-paced environment.     Experience with statistical modelling / machine learning     Strong attention to detail     Comfortable working in a fast paced, highly collaborative, dynamic work environment     Ability to think creatively and solve problems     Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce. job_title: Aircraft Launch and Recovery Equipment (ALRE) Maintenance Planner
job_Description: Job Description  Requisition Number: 5494       Required Travel: 0 - 10%     Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt     Hours Per Week: 40     Security Clearance: Secret     Level of Experience: Mid     Employee Referral Bonus Amount: ERP Amount: $1,000     II         Who We Are     Looking for a way to continue your service to you country? Still have knowledge and experience you want to pass on to the future generations of US Navy sailors? Come and Join the Carrier Availability Support Team (CAST) program!        CAST assigned to the CNO-sponsored availability to enhance Ship’s Force ability to improve the material conditions throughout the ship’s life cycle. CAST is a 4-person team comprised of specialists in the areas of Combat Systems (CS), Aircraft Launch and Recovery Equipment (ALRE), Propulsion Plant, and Hull Mechanical and Electrical Systems (HM&E). They have a wealth of maintenance shipyard experience with mitigating scheduling conflicts as well as working knowledge with various shipyard codes and maintenance organization processes.        Become a member of a team of subject matter experts to assist the TYCOM Maintenance Program Manager (MPM) to assess the progress of work during CVN Shipyard Industrial availabilities. Investigate issues which are putting work into a stop or delay status and reporting that to the MPM so it can be addressed by the project team in a timely manner. The goal of this effort is to reduce schedule delays and support an on time delivery of the ship.          What You Will Do     The selected candidate will provide technical support for availability planning, execution, and development of Ship’s Force work packages and overall Depot Availability Work integration and scheduling onboard Aircraft Carriers. Provide training, recommendations, and guidance to Ship’s Force personnel in industrial availability management, work package development and Ship’s Force Production Teams’ composition and tracking. Develop and maintain availability measures of effectiveness. Prepares and coordinates the plans and schedules for new or existing programs. Determines, monitors, and reviews costs, operational budgets and schedules, and manpower requirements. Supports and participates in negotiations with customer. Analyzes effects of projects upon various areas such as Engineering, Facilities, and the labor pool to determine the most practical and cost-efficient methods to obtain the required resources. Resolves proposal preparation problems and assesses the progress against established plans and parameters. Formulates and recommends corrective action measures such as schedule revisions, manpower adjustments, fund allocations, and work requirements.          Minimum Qualifications           Candidate must have experience in a Senior role in Aircraft Launch and Recovery Equipment (ALRE) or Aviation Fuels equipment maintenance procedures on a CVN.        Must have a strong background associated with the shipboard systems and must have experience on the Availability project team. The position requires a strong technical writing ability and proven capability to communicate effectively to all levels of the Chain of Command.        Computer skills must include proficiency with Microsoft Office products (Outlook, Word, Excel, Access).        Must be a US Citizen.        Must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret DoD Security Clearance.        6 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; 4 years relevant experience with Masters in related field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 10 years relevant experience.                  Physical Requirements    May require working in an office, industrial, shipboard, or laboratory environment. Capable of climbing ladders and tolerating confined spaces and extreme temperature variances.        HII is a global engineering and defense technologies provider. With a 135-year history of trusted partnerships in advancing U.S. national security, HII delivers critical capabilities ranging from the most powerful and survivable naval ships ever built, to unmanned systems, ISR and AI/ML analytics. HII leads the industry in mission-driven solutions that support and enable a networked, all-domain force. Headquartered in Virginia, HII’s skilled workforce is 44,000 strong. For more information, please visit: hii.com.     HII’s Mission Technologies division develops integrated solutions that enable today’s connected, all-domain force. Capabilities include C5ISR systems and operations; the application of AI and machine learning to battlefield decisions; defensive and offensive cyberspace strategies and EW; unmanned, autonomous systems; LVC solutions; platform modernization; and critical nuclear operations. Together, HII's domain expertise and advanced technologies support mission partners anywhere around the globe. For more information, visit tsd.huntingtoningalls.com.     Huntington Ingalls Industries is an Equal Opportunity/Vets and Disabled Employer. U.S. Citizenship may be required for certain positions.
